Reviews.Title: “Breakfast on the outdoor terrace overlooking the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: SusieQNewEngland
Reviews.Content: Our five night stay at the end of March was magical with full sun and temps in the 60's we had breakfast every morning outside on the terrace overlooking the Grand Canal! The last day two ocean liners sailed into the harbor dwarfing the churches and domes and throwing the 17th C into stark relief with the 21st. A wonderful location. Convenient to everything. Now if they just give you a decent pillow on which to lay your sleepy head

Reviews.Title: “strongly recommended”
Reviews.Author: inci61
Reviews.Content: We travel to Venice one or two times a year and always stay at a very special hotel known with itâ€™s antique collection. This time, we could not find a room and decided to stay at Bauer Hotel. The location is excellent; right on the Grand Canal at a 5 min walking distance to San Marco square among the luxuary shops. If you travel by vaporetto from the airport and have luggage, this hotel is ideal since you donâ€™t have to climb any bridges while walking to the hotel.Rooms are great with a seperate living room, good-size walk-in closet, good-size bathroom and a large bedroom. The bed is huge and very comfortable. Overall the hotel is very clean and the staff is really kind and friendly. The stiriking feature is that ceilings are so high that you really feel comfortable. The lobby is also huge with several sitting groups which is very rare in Venice hotels.The magnificent part of the hotel is the terrace right on the Grand Canal. You can enjoy your breakfast or drink while listening to the music of the small waves splashing early in the morning or watching the crowded traffic of the canal and the gondolas as the time passes. The breakfast menu consists of a huge selection of everything. The only downside is it is really expensive like all Venice. I would also be happy to see wi-fi in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Cococurley
Reviews.Content: Very good, will be back, although they need some fluffy pillows, we did complain about this but nothing was done about it. they were like dead

Reviews.Title: “Bauer Venice”
Reviews.Author: Penaw
Reviews.Content: Best thing we did in Venice was to stay at L'Hotel Bauer in Venice. Venice itself is a beautiful location for a vacation but the Hotel Bauer made the stay in Venice sublime. Apart from the excellent location of the building, the service of the staff, the interior design of the magnificent Hotel, the spacious room all made our stay in Venice perfect in spite of the fact that Alitalia managed to lose our luggage upon arrival. The gentlemen working at the concierge were very helpful with every question that we had and were constantly assisting us attempt to locate our suitcase. Regrettably we left the Hotel returning home last night / early this am and still no suitcase. However we will always treasure the memory of our stay at the Bauer. We highly recommend this Hotel for a stay in Venice if you are looking for quality and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a brick wall view”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca095
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment! We were expecting aroom with canal or street view and we got a wall. Lights had to be on at all times as there was no natural light -impossible to know what the weather was like. This didn't come cheap. Having booked through Citalia we have complained over the misrepresentation of their website but after several e-mails and telephone conversations we have got nowhere with the company. Yes the hotel is in an excellent location and breakfast was lovely but would not recommend it as when we walked round Venice we found so many other hotels offering more for a good deal less.

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality and at a good location”
Reviews.Author: sajatjain
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Baur Il Palazzo in the deluxe suites and just fell in love with the place. Venice itself is a very beautiful city and our rooms added another star to it. The rooms were big and spacious and food was also good. The staff was very courteous, polite and helpful. They told us about the city and recommended a few nice places to visit. +The hotel is very close to St. Marks Campanile.

Reviews.Title: “5 star”
Reviews.Author: moefried
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Would anytime come back here. I was here on my honeymoon and they upgraded me to a suite with a porch/deck overlooking the water with stunning views. It's a 5 star hotel with great service, fresh smelling and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “On the Gran Canal!”
Reviews.Author: Michael S
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at this extremely well located hotel. The staff was very helpful and even added towels/pillows to our room upon request. The breakfast banquet is served on the outside terrace overlooking the Basilica and the Gran Canal. Does it get any better than that? Well, yes, when alongside the hotel comes a gondola with a singing gondolier. The bathrooms were very modern and well appointed. Our bed was very comfortable. The food everywhere in Venice is divine. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Think Three Stars - no more!”
Reviews.Author: MontanaKen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bauer (December 27-29) in a â€œDeluxe City Viewâ€� room, while my sister and her husband had a one bedroom (two bath) suite. The hotel has considerable WOW factor upon first viewing of the lobby. Shortly after that, things go downhill. In 1949 after considerable renovation, the Bauer proudly announced that it was the most modern hotel in Venice. Now 60 years later, they boast of being very â€œOld World.â€� Well, the â€œOld Worldâ€� didnâ€™t start in 1949, and, quite frankly, things are looking old and tired! The 1940â€™s era bathroom fittings are decidedly out of fashion â€“ and the Bauer, like so many European hotels, refuses to use shower curtains, or any other effective means of stopping the floor flooding that is a constant in so many Euro-hotels. The tub had a marble slab which extended from the wall to about the one-third point of the tub. It is annoying that water must be cleaned up, but it is also annoying that the bather has to contort in an effort to prevent too much water from getting on the floor. Taking a shower is not a pleasant, easy going event at the Bauer. One evening I returned to the room to find water leaking thru the walls, or coming up from below the floor tiles. A call to housekeeping brought a gentleman with 8 huge towels to mop up the water. â€œCall if you see more water.â€� Fortunately, I didnâ€™t. Lighting in the rooms was dim and grim, the desk had two of its three drawers nailed or glued shut. There were switches on the wall which no longer seemed to have a corresponding use. There was an electronically controlled safe in my room, but none in the suite. Front desk staff seemed off-putting. I approached the front desk and asked for a map. The uniformed gentleman informed me: â€œThe Concierge takes care of that matter.â€� I could see the Concierge was fielding questions from a couple of other guests, so I waited four minutes. When he was free, I asked him for a map. He turned to the original gentleman and asked him to move, so that he, the Concierge, could open the drawer to retrieve a map. The maps were right there in front of the first man I asked. Supreme example of â€œItâ€™s not my job.â€� A clear indicator of poor service. Breakfast was a complete joke. The bar which adjoins the dining room is pressed into service for the breakfast event. Both the bar and the dining room are serviced by those cheap wooden chairs that are covered with a dull colored linen fabric â€“ much like the chairs you might encountered dressed in white at a wedding reception. No style, no class. And the entire breakfast experience is very much like a mad house. Tables are pushed together to accommodate larger parties, the aisle ways are blocked by chairs taking up walkway space, choke points impede traffic flow. And all for a very mediocre buffet. I was amazed that there was no good Italian bread â€“ only tasteless dough balls. The scrambled eggs originated as powder. The food selections were dismal. The OJ was, however, excellent. The fruit was all canned. The buffet was not worth the effort. Even if lucky enough to be seated in the main part of the main dining room, which overlooks the Grand Canal, the windows are so small, that hardly a view to the exterior can be had, unless you were super-lucky enough to be at one of the three tables that were co-located with the three forward-facing minimal windows. Of course, the Bauer is very well located and it seems to be getting by on that one attribute alone. By no stretch of the imagination is this a great hotel. It is very short on style and grace, and the modern amenities just arenâ€™t there. My room was on the fifth floor, and the tiny little elevator (no more than three people) could take me there. But once on the fifth floor, my room was on a slightly different fifth floor, so I had to walk up and down a flight of about 6-7 stairs. At night, I discovered that the stairs are not lit, and there is no handrail. The door to my room was so worn at the edges, that light poured out from around the door jamb. I was never really sure it was completely closed â€“ it certainly did not seem secure. The hotel still uses old fashioned keys. However, they would not give my sister and her husband two keys. Their plan was to escort the party without a key to the room and let them in. Perhaps, to be charitable, the Bauer management thinks this is â€œservice.â€� I loved Venice, and expect to return. Now I have to start a research project to find a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, even if you are relegated to the Casa Nova building”
Reviews.Author: GettingThereJoe
Reviews.Content: So when they say Casanova, it isn't the nicer of the buildings. I didn't know it was a separate building at all. I did feel a little bit of a pariah going to the adult's hotel for breakfast buffet but man, was the buffet amazing. Even if they aren't the friendliest of the bunch, the hotel is very well designed, the rooms are beautiful and the location is unbeatable. Wifi for the entire trip is only 20 Euro. Not per day. Plus they have free wifi in the lobby. Its a beautiful hotel and maybe nicer than the Ritz Carlton. I just wished they were a little more friendly

Reviews.Title: “Great location; spacious suite.”
Reviews.Author: sharon2004
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bauer for 7 days in October and were very happy there. On other trips to Venice I'd stayed in more elegant hotels as well as less expensive hotels, but the Bauer is my new favorite because I felt I was in the center of the city with an easy walk almost anywhere. We knew the rooms run small so requested an upgrade to a suite. Our corner suite on the second floor overlooked the elegant shops and smaller canal and bridge, with floor to ceiling windows and doors flooding the rooms with light, and beautiful heavy draperies for blocking out the light in the early morning. (see photos) The photo ops from the balconies were great and I loved hearing the church bells ring and gondoliers sing! The breakfast buffet was just right. That said, I will admit I was on a tour when staying at the Bauer so never knew exactly what we were charged for the suite. It was probably a high price, but helped make our trip so wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - All Non Smoking Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Dbygh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bauer for one night prior to embarking on a cruise. Two things that appealed to us were its conveneient location to St.Marks Square and the fact that all rooms are non-smoking. Otherwise the rooms, facilities, and services are slightly above ordinary. It is quite expensive but they do offer special rates if you book well in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ClementinaH
Reviews.Content: Before taking a cruise I spent a night at the hotel. The location is great, however you need a water taxi from the airport (aprox. 100 euros) and another water taxi to the cruise (aprox. 100 euros). The staff is very courteous. The rooms are small but in good conditions.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry but I wasn't impressed with the Bauer Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shawn M
Reviews.Content: The online pictures of the Bauer Boutique Hotel looked quite impressive and elegant. When we arrived to the beautiful lobby we were excited that our room would be equally as beautiful! When we walked up to the lobby desk, there were a few people complaining about water taxi's not being called. That made us aware that we needed to put our request for transporation early and reconfirm the morning we left. When our room was ready, my husband and I were puzzled we had to leave the main building and walk around a very dark corner to this old boutique hotel. The elegance was gone! The ancient buiding did have Gothic decor but no real charm. The room decor was dark, cold with no real thought put into making it more inviting for the guest. The extremely small room (more like a closet) had a creepy feeling, not bad it you're on a ghost tour! The mattress too seemed to be as old as the building. We had no view of the city from the small window. We actually were a little stone throw away from another window where one could easily look into our room! On the positive side was the updated marble bathroom. It was more spacious and quite clean. The location of the hotel was in walking distance to restaurants. The morning of our departure, we called twice for assistance with our luggage and NO one ever arrived! We unfortunately had to carry it down ourselves! I must add that we had been on a three week vacation around Europe with mulitple heavy bags! The staff was quite apologetic but too little too late. For the price we paid to stay in this hotel, we would never go back again.

Reviews.Title: “5 star luxury but with prices to match”
Reviews.Author: DRM69
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and great location. Staff were excellent as was the food. When they say breakfast finishes at 10.30 a.m. they mean it so don't arrive at 10.25!!!! Check out the painting behind the reception, really cool. If you want to buy decent Murano glass take out a mortgage before you travel.

Reviews.Title: “When in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Lebat
Reviews.Content: Great Location, great weather, fantastic city Water taxi in from the airport Rooftop spa drinking champagne and eating strawberries. Eating breakfast alongside the Grand Canal. Not cheap but then again it's not every day you have a 25th anniversary

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: Danielle B
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent was able to book this hotel for us at a great rate. When we arrived they said they were also gonna upgrade us to a suite! It was unexpected and an awesome treat. The morning breakfast that was included with the room was awesome! They had a great buffet of hot and cold breakfast foods. Plus they also had tables outside on the patio where you can watch the Grand Canal traffic. We also got help from the front desk setting up a water taxi to the airport. Very nice staff and great location, close to St. Marks Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: mohlab
Reviews.Content: Stayed with family @ Bauer's hotel in Venice in mid July.Honestly we were worried about the weather and the possibility of facing the bad water smell during this period of the year but fortunately we had a wonderful weather and all our trip was superb. Regarding the hotel it was an excellent choice,the location ,service ,cleanliness and breakfast were perfect, the room though was on the small size but acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: msviv
Reviews.Content: I agree with many of the comments here. The hotel is in a great location but the rooms are a bit outdated and the staff isn't terribly friendly. Given the cost, it could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Style of a bygone age”
Reviews.Author: SurreyHenny
Reviews.Content: We were initially disappointed that the view from our room on the fifth floor was of a wall, even though it was very attractively painted! Our two night pre-cruise stay there was part of a package, so we didn't know if we were entitled to anything better...in any case the hotel was full. The room had all the elegance of a bygone age, the walls covered with silk. It was very quiet, with two doors separating it from the hallway, and shutters at the window which were lowered at the time of the evening turn down service. The bed was very comfortable and towelling robes and slippers were provided. The marble bathroom was attractive and very spacious, however due to the design of the bathtub not so easy for those with dodgy hips to get in and out. The public rooms are magnificent and the verandah where breakfast is served has the most stunning views. Breakfast is good. We have had better, but it is taken in the most beautiful location. Service was friendly and very efficient and the location of the hotel cannot be beaten.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: poshhotels4us
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Bauer Hotel by Boat Taxi - the staff greeted us with a hand shake and made us feel extremely welcome. The decor and style of the hotel is grand and spectacular. We were upgraded to a Junior Suite - the room was spacious with a king sized bed, beautiful furniture and a jacuzzi bath! There is air con but we had a balcony with opening windows so there was no need for the air con - which was an advantage. The view from our suite was amazing - looking out on one of the canals, Prada and Versace!! We had dinner in the restaurant which was a real treat - the Steak was amazing and all the food was outstanding. We also had breakfast included in our room rate - 50 euros otherwise - American buffet style and all food was of a high quality. We had various teas, coffees, juices and alcohol drinks - all great in a lovely setting. The staff are all helpful, courteous and polite - all appear geniunely happy that you are staying in their hotel. The staff also remember you during your stay which is a nice touch. The hotel is a few minutes walk from the Grand Canal and St.Mark's square - perfect location!! Overall, a fantastic hotel in a wonderful location - we will stay again and would reccommend to anyone!! The only negative comment I can make regarding the hotel is it being very very very expensive, 35 euros for a 2 x cups of tea, coffee and a coke, 60 euros a steak in the resteraunt, 7 euros a bottle of water from the mini bar etc, i realise Venice is expensive but the prices seemed a little bit extreme.

Reviews.Title: “Great but could be so much better.”
Reviews.Author: Scotty2403
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just came back from a 3 night stay in Venice where we stayed at the Bauer Hotel. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed the weekend and the Hotel was great, especially the location which cannot be beaten, but just some tips which might help ensure you enjoy it... 1. Make sure you get breakfast included in your rate. It is marvellous to sit on the terrace right on the grand canal, but if it's not in your rate...wait for it...it costs â‚¬50 per person...!!! 2. My wife and I sat on our last night on the same terrace and had a couple of goodbye Venice drinks...wait for it...â‚¬70 for two vodka and coke and two Spritz... Lastly, the room was really nice but lacks some amenities you would expect in 5 star hotels such as wifi, iron etc.... Overall we enjoyed it but you need to be a bit street wise.

Reviews.Title: “'Venice in style'”
Reviews.Author: joysharples
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in September, bed and breakfast.. Arrived via water taxi. Wonderful location overlooking Grand Canal and close to St Marks Square. Breakfast on the Terrace was amazing as were drinks in the evening, despite being expensive, Staff very helpful, however on check in there was a long queue which took half an hour to serve - more staff required, as it took longer than the water taxi from the airport! Concierge very helpful. A wonderful Hotel to retire to when you have had a busy and exhausting day exploring the City - peaceful, calm, luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Ray B
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bauer L'Hotel for 2 nights in September. What a magnificant place. Right on the Grand Canal and next to San Marco square. Rooms were great, staff were fantastic, breakfast awesome. This hotel deserves it's five star rating. Concierge was more than helpful and sorted out last minute tickest to the opera and a complimentary tour through San Marco. Scored a great deal through Otel.com. This hotel combined with the romance of Venice made for a fantastic and memorable trip. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Average and expensive”
Reviews.Author: Kkuh
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bauer for 4 nights in September. The hotel has a great location near the San Marco square. Staff were not so friendly. The suite we booked was clean but looked outdated. I did not try the room service. Overall this hotel is average, over priced but has great location.

Reviews.Title: “sheer luxury”
Reviews.Author: mgt063
Reviews.Content: If your going to venice you must indulge yourself by staying here. Stayed 2 nights and worth every pound sign. breakfast is anything you want whilst sitting looking on to the grand canal. the service is first class plus. we had two romantic nights in this very old fashioned or boutique hotel. the room was clean and had a side view of the canal. its situated 2 min walk from st marks and toget there you pass every designer store you can imagine.considering you spend very little time in the hotel it was fantastic to come back at the end of the day and sip a lovely cocktail on the patio overlooking the water. the staff are very attentive, our bags were taken from us and delivered to the room and taken from the room and delivered to foyer on leaving. the only way to arrive is to indulge in a speed boat from the airport which takes you right tot he door of the hotel, its spectacular. we returned 2 weeks later with the kids aged 11 and 14 and they will never forget the experience. expensive .. but worth every penny, i wouldnt do venice any other way

Reviews.Title: “VEry NICE”
Reviews.Author: SMET61
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I have just spent two wonderful romantic nights at the Bauer hotel in Venice (16-18 September 2011). We originally reserved a four star hotel elsewhere with impeccable reviews, but decided to risk (because of some mixed reviews) a change to a deluxe room at this hotel, due to its superb location, 5* rating and a marginal price advantage (606 euro B&B for the two nights vs 740). We are glad that we did. From the onset the staff were helpful and friendly. The concierge provided us with excellent advice and provided complimentary boat services. The grandeur of the lobby area and the wide corridors to the rooms made you feel that this was once a grand place indeed. The room was comfortable, clean and well maintained. Housekeeping kept it that way. Had we paid the full asking price we would have cause to feel let down because there are a few niggles that do not justify it. The reception desk is a little slow. There was no tea making facility in the room, which was average sized but functional and had pleasing decor. The large bed was very comfortable. All in all we would stay here again. Thank you Bauer Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The splendour”
Reviews.Author: Marado12
Reviews.Content: Arriving by Riva boat at Bauer is an experience wich will never be forget. The lobby brith supless. The bedrooms are splendorous. Having lunch outside is surreal with the view to the entrance of the gran canal. Bauer reflects venice at is maximum splendour.

Reviews.Title: “Bauer Hotel rip off merchants”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: I booked the Bauer Hotel for five nights on a breakfast inclusive basis which was confirmed by the hotel what they dont tell you is that if you have breakfast in bed all items are charged individually with no allownce for the all inclusive element for example a youghurt is â‚¬10 half a mellon is â‚¬22.In addition .When the hotel quotes an tax inclusive Rate they omit the local occupancy tax . This hotel is staffed by the most unfriendly unhelpful staff you could ever meet .The rooms are substandard and poorly equipped .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !”
Reviews.Author: naeAthens
Reviews.Content: We spent, me and my wife, three nights at Bauer hotel in Venice and all I can say is that the location, the hotel rooms and the staff can make your stay in Venice a relaxing five star experience. Congratulations to all at the Bauer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Rooms are not 5* or worth price”
Reviews.Author: hazeloxrob
Reviews.Content: Whilst this hotel is in a great location at the entrance of the Grand Canal by St Mark's Square, the room we had was not anything close to a 5* standard. We toured round Veneto and thought we'd splash out (pun intended) on our Venice Hotel and have a little luxury. We were very disappointed. The ground floor of the hotel is very large and luxurious giving false hope about the rooms above. After a lengthy check-in we were shown to our room which was smaller than the Ibis we had stayed at in Verona. The bathroom was marble (guessing that was their justification for the 5* rating) but small. The view out of the window was commercial roof tops - air conditioning units and the like. Never mind we thought, put it down to experience. We thought we'd at least try out the spa - it says to call the concierge to book which we did. Whilst the Sauna is free to use (if reserved) you have to pay â‚¬80 to use the jacuzzi?? Why? Surely I didn't pay several hundred euros to have to pay to use the facilities? The hotel seemed to think it was ok as they supplied strawberries whilst you were in it. Needless to say we declined to use it and instead headed out to into Venice. Make sure if you still decide to book that breakfast is included in the price of the room otherwise that is another â‚¬50 per person. And was not the best on our stay around the region either. We will not be staying at any of the Bauer Hotels again if that is the charges they apply for a 4* (at best) room with no real added value. The help given for the concierge on how to get to the hotel as we had a car wasn't very helpful. Whilst he booked us into a Garage he didn't tell us where it was or where to go following it. Again, you'd have thought they would've provided free parking, but no - something else that is additional to the room price.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced / Creepy Place!”
Reviews.Author: NOBLEWARRIOR2008
Reviews.Content: The hotel corridors are exactly like the ones from "The Shining!" Super creepy. The prices are WAY overpriced. I think a cup of tea was 12 euros. The room was I think 600 euros for a basic room. The elevators are a joke! I would only recommend this hotel to suckers!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel Bauer”
Reviews.Author: JillandJohn012
Reviews.Content: We knew when we booked , Venice was expensive but we were more than satisfied with everything we experienced at Hotel Bauer. The room was large, elaborately decorated and very Venician. The bed was enormous and comfortable. The bathroom was small but more than adequate with excellent water pressure in the shower, high quality products and enormous fluffy towels. The concierge, Marko, was so helpful with advice of times to visit attractions to avoid extra large numbers of other tourists. His advice on dining places in Burano and in Venice, were affordable with excellent quality food. Nothing was too much trouble for him. Breakfast on the Terrace was amazing watching all the traffic on the Grand Canal and gondolas in the canal next to the hotel. We included breakfast in the package we purchased on line and were not disappointed. We had dinner in the Restaurant and the service was very attentive and the food was wonderful. Would we say at Hotel Bauer again? In a heart-beat!

Reviews.Title: “Over-priced, over-rated hotel in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: IzzyEdmonton
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us by Leading Hotels of the World. We were truly disappointed. After spending 5 wonderful nights at the Byblos Art Hotel in nearby Verona (also a Leading Small Hotel of the World), we were expecting the same fantastic experience at the Bauer but it didn't happen. Since we didn't know how to get from the Venice airport to the hotel, we called the hotel & asked them to arrange transport for us. They charged us 264 Euros for the transfer when, we later found out, it normally costs only 100 Euros! Check in took a long time. We found that the staff in general was cold, snobby & not very welcoming. Everyone seemed to only want to do the specific job that they were assigned, and did not go out of their way to help. For example, I went to the front desk & asked for a map of Venice. The lady at reception told me to go to the concierge & wait in line, when she could have easily reached behind the concierge & got the map for me. The lobby was nicely decorated though very dark. Our room was huge & nicely furnished & comfortable. The bathroom was very small for the size of the bedroom & the shower was only about the size of a cruise ship shower - small! Beds were comfortable & sheets were clean. However, housekeeping in general was 3 star, not 5, as this hotel was rated. There was evidence that the previous guest had shaved in the bathroom & this had not been cleaned up prior to us checking in. It was still there the next day after they supposedly cleaned our room again! Toilet paper was not replenished. Carpet was not vacuumed. I would have let this go if I was paying for a 3 star hotel, but at 565 Euros a night, I expected a lot more than what I got. Wireless internet access was HORRIBLE. It would cut out constantly, making any attempt to surf the net or do any work on your computer impossible. Again, not acceptable for a 5 star hotel. Do not eat at the hotel restaurant. The food was fine but way over priced. A dinner for 5 with only 1 bottle of wine cost us almost 550 Euros & most of us did not have appetizer or dessert. I know Venice is expensive but this was ridiculous. The hotel is centrally located & has a nice view of the square & the canal. I guess this is what you're paying for. However, there were too many deficiencies for a so called 5 star hotel & at the rate that we paid for, I did not feel that we got our money's worth. I would NOT stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Louieg63
Reviews.Content: My wife and kids had the great fortune to stay at this hotel. The property was perfectly located along the Grand Canal with a side canal that drops you off at the hotels front door. Upon our arrival, we were upgraded to two suites overlooking the canal. Needless to say, the trip started off great. We were there only one night as we were departing on a cruise the next day. The hotel is first class and the staff was great. The concierge was a bit overwhelmed but his attitude did not detract from my overall stay. Not cheap, but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel - the best of four we have used in Venice. We will stay again.”
Reviews.Author: JeremyC-99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for just one night in July 2011. We stayed in a 'Superior Suite' which was quite expensive but wonderful. The cost was partly influenced by it being Biennale time. Our suite was very large, very tastefully decorated and furnished. The bathrooms (there were two) were beautifully fitted out and with a great shower. The king size bed was extremely comfortable. There was a safe in the room and free WiFi. The breakfast room and balcony looking out over the Grand Canal was beautiful and the breakfast offerings were excellent. Breakfast was included in the price of the room. Service by staff on arrival and throughout our stay was impeccable and warmly welcoming. So - we should have been happy because we treated ourselves to a nice room. It is worth noting, however, that the Rialto Hotel, where we have stayed on one of the previous occasions, was at the same period of time, more expensive and yet on our experience is a long way short of the quality of Hotel Bauer. The hotel is really well located next to the Grand Canal and within about 200m of Piazza San Marco. I am told that the rooms on the side of the hotel facing over the small canal that runs alongside it are in the nicer part of the hotel. I cannot vouch for that on personal experience but our room on that side was certainly excellent. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: fmlandy
Reviews.Content: The Bauer Hotel is a beautiful hotel in Venice overlooking the Grand Canal. It's location is great, the rooms are old-world gorgeous, and the staff is amazing. The general manager greeted us to ask if we needed anything anytime he saw us, and the front desk and concierge staff was so helpful and accomodating. We loved absolutely everything about this hotel and would recommend it to anyone going to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place”
Reviews.Author: Paulfrankye
Reviews.Content: It has been a wonderful experience. Hotel and rooms are extremely clean and comfortable and the concierge is absolutely fantastic. He'll suggest you the best restaurant and sightseens giving you the possibility to enjoy Murano island, even if sometimes you risk to find unprofessional sale agents ( in Linea Murano or Linea mazzuccato I met a men kidding me telling tales about colors made with precious stones and chandeliers exposed in museums around the world ). Visit also Torcello island according with the restaurant mr Minatelli will suggest you.

Reviews.Title: “''We loved it and hope to be back''”
Reviews.Author: levo69
Reviews.Content: Just returned from four nights at the Bauer hotel, Venice. I must have read most, if not all of the trip adviser reviews before booking this particular hotel, as well as some from other review sites. I was a little anxious before arriving, in fear of being put into one of the back rooms which may have been older and smaller. We stayed in room 327 and 328, next door to each other which was a bonus. (and something we had requested of time of booking). POSITIVES; Most of the reviews give much hype about the wonderfull location, so i was not at all surprised to find this is the case. I dont think it is posible to get accomodation anywhere better in Venice. Buffet breakfast; We found there was a good selection and it ran from 07:00 until nearly 11am. Sparkling wine as well as a selection of mineral waters and juices were included. It was nice to see the orange juice was fresh, not from concentrate. It was also possible to order fresh coffees and tea at your table. Overall we were more than happy with the breakfast, and would fail to see any reason for anyone not being happy with it. The location of the dining area was another bonus which really made it special. Furthermore, on floor seven there was another dining room and buffet on the terrace overlooking the grand canal. Guests can choose which they would prefere, or even dining at both in the same morning as i did once ! The staff were friendly, charming and efficiant, as one would expect from a five star hotel. We loved our room. It was decorated in traditional quality furnishings with good quality beddings. The bathroom was finished in marble throughout. The wardrobes were ample. Lighting and mirrors were plentiful and good. The a/c worked brilliantly, a cool welcome after a hot and sweaty tour of the shops. The towels were soft and fluffy, and we got dressing gowns and slippers to match. The bath was lovely and we had two showers over the bath, one hand held and the other fixed on the ceiling. Water pressure etc was faultless. Overall the showers were fantastic. We carefully examined our room for any trace of dirt as we are quite particular. It was spotless everywhere, full marks. The shower heads had a few limescale marks however but this was the only negative. NEGATIVES; Many of the reviews stated that the rooms were small. We were more than happy with the size of our room even with the addition of a third bed for our todler. That said, i have stayed in many five star hotels which have had much larger rooms and i can appreciate that if an individual is accustomed to large five star rooms then they may be disappointed. The bathroom again, was smaller than what some might expect from a five star room but we did not find this an issue. (I have stayed at the Ritz before and not even had a full size bath !) Price; we paid a lot of money for our room but was glad we had not gone for a budget option. However the food and drinks prices were a little alarming. 8 Euros for a can of cola, 6 euros for a small pack of biscuits. 9 Euros for a cup of tea. Luckily we had a deal whereas we were given a 50 Euros per room free spending voucher. Great we thought, that'll pay for a meal and a bottle of wine. (As we had 2 rooms thus 100 Euros), but not so. It just about covered a handful of snacks and soft drinks. An individual pizza in the hotel restaurant was 22 Euros, which could be had for 7 Euros down the street. But that said, i take it those folk who are paying five star prices are happy to pay more for such items. Also, after checking with other five star hotels in the area, these prices did not look out of place. Overall we had a wonderful stay at the Baeur hotel. It is perhaps not quite perfect for everyone or without it's issues but i dont think we would have enjoyed Venice quite as much if we had stayed anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cadugan
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Venice. The hotel was in a great location, just minutes from St.Mark's square and other places to visit. It sits on the Grand Canal, so it meant a great location to have a meal or for breakfast (which was excellent) right by the waterside. The room was also very good - we were overlooking the canal by the side of the hotel- with great towels, toiletries and fantastic maid service. It was expensive, however (beware, the de pisis restaurant is very expensive and the food isn't up to the price) but in Venice the costs can be higher. For a special occasion, it can't be beaten and i would recommend it thoroughly.

Reviews.Title: “Location....and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Andrew
Reviews.Content: Can there be a better way of getting to your hotel thaan a water taxi down the canals to the side entrance and a warm welcome? The Bauer has some quirks, but the family run feel is there and the concierge was very helpful. Our rooms had no view - but please make sure you have a breakfast inclusive rate becuase it was lovely, but not oly that has to have one of the great views of any breakfast spot in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Bauer alpalazzo”
Reviews.Author: mmbdo
Reviews.Content: This delightful hotel is adjacent to the Bauer hotel. We were upgraded to a siute through our America express platinum card. The room was incredibly clean and comfortable with a view of Venice that could not be matched. We could clearly see the Grand canal, St. Mark's cathedral and Basillica. The service was spectacular with every detail taken care of. I doubt there could be e better place to stay in Venice. It is very expensive but if this is not an issue would highly recomend it

Reviews.Title: “Very elegant hotel and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: km0722
Reviews.Content: A tour I was on wrapped up in Venice and our last stay was at the Hotel Bauer for two nights. It was a lovely hotel very close to St. Mark's Cathedral and Piazza and many many boutiques as well. The service staff was excellent as well as the desk staff and our stay was most comfortable. The breakfast is probably one of the most generous of any of our hotels along the way. It was very good, very opulent, and very filling. No lunch required after that breakfast! I'd stay there again if I were in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A superb hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AHMEDSULIMAN55
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Bauer Hotel for 3 nights on 22nd June.An absolutely superb hotel,the best location and impeccable service.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Bauer had it All”
Reviews.Author: GordonGroup
Reviews.Content: From the moment we were greeted from our water taxi to the moment we left two days later, the Hotel Bauer was pefection. The staff was intuitive, the food and views of the Grand Canal were bot spectacular and the room was large, yet furnished in a cozy manner.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Bauer was great, until they changed management.”
Reviews.Author: MikeMerriman
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bauer has a service problem. I saw many heated arguments between staff and guest. In one such incident, a lady asked a waiter to clean a table at which she wished to sit. He refused, saying that he was cleaning another table, and she should be happy sitting there instead. In another, a staff member actually kicked out a family of four while they were waiting for the shuttle boat to the other side. They protested, saying they were trying to get to their hotel room at the Palladio. He refused to let them wait. Unreal. See for yourself. Go to the front desk at reception and just wait. They are understaffed, untrained, and don't care. We will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Dream Come True”
Reviews.Author: chicagochic77
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Bauer Hotel was our family's "splurge" for our tour of Italy. It didn't disappoint. From the moment we were greeted by Giancarlo, the hotel manager, we were treated to a superb experience. The location is extraordinary and we particularly enjoyed the views from the open-air veranda for breakfast and cocktails. We were also pleasantly surprised when the hotel responded to our email requests for a suite with a sitting room large enough to accommodate our two teenage boys. In lieu of only a fold-out couch, they put us in an internal but larger suite that could accommodate a roller bed as well as the couch. It was perfect for our family of four. This was very customized treatment and showed that they paid attention to our request, even during a busy season! When I checked out, I saw that they had all of our email exchanges stapled to our file -- it was clear they were paying attention to their guests' requests! Giancarlo also was there to say good-bye to our family when we left. We were really impressed by this personal touch!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible! Dirty and smelly with an attitude!”
Reviews.Author: skiorsea
Reviews.Content: We went to Venice as part of our planned 3 week Europe trip with our tween daughter. The location of this hotel was good, as it was close to St. Mark's Square, but that was the only plus. We booked a room with a separate area for her to sleep, which this room had.Our room was not clean. It smelled. The bed and the pull out for my daughter were uncomfortable. It did not resemble any of the photos on their website in any way. It overlooked what I will call an abandoned patio area, at close to ground level. The tile floors in the bathrooms were spotted and disgusting. The shower was unclean. We had planned to stay for several nights but left after just one, not wanting to spend any more money on this place. They were abrupt at the desk, which is not too surprising.

Reviews.Title: “Some Issues”
Reviews.Author: prs54fmpu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights following a recommendation, when we first arrived the hotel is really impressive very nice lobby and entrance area, our room was not ready which is OK as we had arrived in the middle of the morning, so we dropped our bags and went into Venice, is was clear from the outset that the position of the hotel commanded its pricing, it is surrounded by the best shops, When we got back we were escorted to the room which was a nice size and obviously had some refurb at some point, it also had a nice terrace which overlooked the piazza. The bed is somewhat hard but a large size; electric shutter blinds give you extra darkness at night. There are no tea and coffee making facilities in the room, but after a discussion with the front desk they did provide a kettle and cups we had to provide the rest. First night no problem but come the second night we found we were above the bar area which has been turned into a night club on Saturday nights, not what you would expect from a 5 star so at 1 oâ€™clock in the morning we rang the front desk to complain to be told that there was nothing they could do but agreed it was wrong, an hour later I went to the front desk to be told it would end at 4 and there was no duty manager to speak to, we did get it turned down, but sleeping was a non-starter. In the morning I complain to the management and they moved us to a very nice suite and provided a bottle of champagne which was very nice and much appreciated, but it should not have happened in the first place and to have no duty manager through the night for a 5 star hotel is un-heard of. The Bauer is expensive but you know this when you book, is it 5 star, not convinced, I think it thinks it is but when you compare it to other 5 star hotels in the world it falls well short, just being expensive does not make it special this is also the only 5 star I have been in that supply a tea bag for tea in the bar, this is cheap and nothing less than proper tea should be the standard, I know this may seem petty but it provides an idea of what you get for your money. The staff are good, they sorted our problem quickly, but why it happened needs to be looked into. Would I stay at the Bauer again, possibly the staff make your stay an enjoyable one, but the rest could sway me to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, not cheap, but that`s Venice”
Reviews.Author: GeraldF-G
Reviews.Content: This hotel was full of surprises, A fabulous terrace directly overlooking the Grand Canal in one of the best Venice positions and staff who were impeccable and hugely courteous. The Art Deco lobby is impressive and connects with the adjacent somewhat grand Bauer Palazzio. Together they share the terraces, bars and dining rooms so why stay at the more expensive Palazzio? Shuttle boat connects across the canal to the Spa and the water taxi from the airport arrives directly at the hotel entrance. Our room (suite) was spacious and very ordinary in tems of decor.Excellent bathroom and sitting room off the bedroom. 80 euro was the intended charge for a dip in their roof top jacuzzi - Ridiculous price. The hotel also wanted to charge us 230 euros for a water taxi transfer back to the airport.at 7pm We booked the water taxi ourself for 100 euros which picked us up from the hotel door and took us to the airport dock. From there it`s just a 7 minute level, covered stroll to the terminal - or a 130 euro 3 minute transfer by Mercedes! The food was delicious, the staff superb, the hotel location perfect. The pillows were a disaster though! Of course I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: mmcbDenver
Reviews.Content: The last time we were in Venice we stayed in the Bauer Palazzo. This time, the Palazzo was nearly full so the only rooms remaining were very high priced. Since Venice is already super expensive, we elected to stay in the Bauer. We booked a Deluxe City view room which was nice but very small (not unusual for Europe) but they gave us a room with a huge deck. It had a table and 4 chairs and looked out on the campo below in front of the San Moise church and the Prada / Versace/ Bottega Veneta stores. Wow! We got carry out food every day and ate outside on the deck. We had views in 3 directions of all of Venice. Just incredible! The hotel would have been fine without the deck but it was spectacular with it. It is an old hotel in Venice and is just what I expect. Old Italian luxury hotels are opulent and formal. Our room was quite nice albeit small but as I can see from some of the other reviews here, not all rooms in the Bauer are up to snuff. We had a flat screen TV for example, and a walk-in closet. The concierge is eager to book guests on all sorts of expensive day trips. He looked down his nose at us for going to Cannaregio every night but we went anyway with great results. The breakfast at the Bauer is fantastic. We ate both downstairs and up on the 7th floor and couldn't' decide which we liked better. The primary difference is the angle of the view (food is the same). The location of the Bauer is unbeatable. It is close to everything but away from the Piazza San Marco crowds and the noise. The elevators are very small- those comments are correct. Coming down from breakfast one morning a couple got on with us and it tipped the needle! My guess is that if you stay in the cheapest room at the Bauer, you will likely be dissatisfied. I think they have spent their remodeling euros on nicer rooms. (Ours was not the top end at all but it was in a category that I think they have focused on and improved). One more thing: they gave us a code for the internet that worked on all of our devices at the same time. We had 2 laptops, 2 IPhones and an IPad with us. All the other hotels would give us a code that we could use for our laptops only. Very convenient. There is a fee for the internet although that seems to be standard.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel! Beautiful waterfront, exquisite buffet presentation!”
Reviews.Author: MB_Cine
Reviews.Content: Beautiful waterfront, exquisite buffet presentation! The Hotel Bauer is an older high-class hotel kept in excellent condition. Very courteous and friendly staff. We had a beautiful spacious room, seperate entry way, walk-in closet, marble bathroom with dual sinks, tub, and shower. Extended tv channels (Bloomberg). The bed however, was not so comfortable- though I'm biased.. I love 'heavenly beds' ;) Loved this hotel! Loved Venice! Just make sure not to take the gondola rides just out side of the hotel. The ones by the Hard Rock are a better value.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly spectacular”
Reviews.Author: fantasy14
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as a matter of chance and by george are we glad we did. The room was fantastic, breakfast sublime and staff very friendly and pleasant. Wonderful experience. Go and try for yourself. Close to everything soevening walks and gondola trips easy.

Reviews.Title: “More like a 3 star with a 5 star price tag”
Reviews.Author: Hollywoodfresh
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a huge disappointment. We thought during our Italian Honeymoon would spoil our selves with at least one 5 star Hotel and we were very upset with our choice. We paid a huge price for a standard room, a room with some lights that didnt work and very minimal lighting for the ones that did work which made it really hard to see what you were doing at times. The carpet was old, very poor paint restorations in alot of parts of the room as well as a rock hard bed with rock hard pillows. The windows were ultra thin which made it hard to sleep with all the outside noise at night. The breakfast was very poor, our 3 star hotel in Rome had a much better breakfast with heaps more variety. At this hotel, if you didnt make it to breakfast by 8am you were not left with much to choose from. The service was not 5 star standard how ever it was not the worst. Finally, the hotel does not give you swipe cards to get in your room, its the old fashioned key which gets very annoying to carry around and making sure its not lost. I will definately say that we will NEVER stay here again. On a better note, Venice is stunning and we look forward to returning hopefully with better accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE LOVE LOVE The Bauer Hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TheaHartley
Reviews.Content: LOVE LOVE LOVE this Hotel!!!! Wished we could have stayed longer!!! We will for sure come back here over and over again and recommend to all our friends and family and business acquintances. Anyone reading this, if you plan to visit Venice, huge mistake if you don't book this hotel. From the breakfast, the rooms, location, concierge service, the bellman were all superb! Overall this is a great hotel and a beautiful hotel overlooking the Grand Canal. Thank you Bauer Hotel for making our Venezia experience unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay as good as the first”
Reviews.Author: Ayrshire999
Reviews.Content: After a memorable trip to the Bauer in 2010, we returned in 2011 and enjoyed another four wonderful nights at this elegant Venetian grande dame! I cannot think of enough good things to say about this Hotel and can barely think of any negatives. Gorgeous rooms (at a price), impeccable staff, fabulous food and a wonderful location - the epitome of Venetian style and charm. Roll on 2012!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: TerriLondon
Reviews.Content: We went to Venice on 10 February for three nights and stayed at the Hotel Bauer. We were fortunate to get this hotel on an amazing deal so paid pretty much half price for the stay. The hotel is really easy to get to from Marco Polo airport, we got the bus and then the Vaporetto. It says on the hotel directions to get off at San Marco Vaporesso but get off at San Marco itself as you can then get the quicker vaporetto and there's literally a minute extra walking. Our room was huge - beautiful wooden floors, lots of space, the bathroom was really nice and fully stocked with everything you need. We didn't have a room with a view but that didn't really matter, they were just so nice anyway. The buffet breakfast is great - it's served in a room with a fantastic view over the Grand Canal. The food is really varied, there's hot food (the best buttery yummy scrambled eggs, bacon, pancakes and sandwiches) and then lots of different pastries, ham, cheese etc. I saw people requesting different things and getting them too. It can get very busy but the wait isn't usually that long. We didn't drink in any of the bars or the go to the attached club so can't comment on that. The bells from the basilica can wake you in the morning, but it's quite a nice sound and it didn't really bother us. The location is terrific, you are literally 60 seconds walk away from St Mark's Square, a 10 minute walk from the Rialto Bridge - (Venice is a lot smaller than it looks like on the maps!). You're in the heart of some designer shops, it's close to bars, restaurants and other shops. Don't ask the hotel to organise your gondola ride, it will cost you about 20 Euros more than the standard cost (good job we asked before we sorted it ourselves!). Also worth noting that if you use the gym (my partner is in training for the marathon so needed to) you have to pay - he was on the treadmill for just over an hour and that cost 20 Euros! We were very surprised by that as the gym manager didn't mention that when we went up to look so we only found out when we checked out. That aside, a beautiful hotel, would definitely recommend it - especially if you get it on the deal we did!

Reviews.Title: “Defiantly not a 5 Star Hotel.Who did they pay?”
Reviews.Author: Keith_and_Audrey
Reviews.Content: What 5 star hotel do you stay where you are expected to pay additional charges for 1. Internet (Euro 20) 2. Gym (Euro 10) 3 Jacuzzi/Steam room must be pre-booked and only opens at specific times (Eighth floor and no lift access) 4. No kettle or complementary refreshments in the room (Coffee Euro 12) 5. No Iron in room or available at main desk (Costs to have one garment pressed min Euro 15). 6. Extortionate prices for drinks (Be aware of a guy asking politely to hang up your jacket then only when leaving asking for a euro as payment) In addition the rooms are very small with no full length mirrors and there is little hanging space for clothes Normally when one stays in a 5 star hotel you expect all of the above to be included as a minimum in the price you are paying to stay there. The above clearly evidences that this hotel is a complete rip off and is at best operating a 3 star service

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised despite ugly exterior of Bauer”
Reviews.Author: Islanlady
Reviews.Content: The Bauer hotel entrance is singularly ugly 1940's constructivist style, when seen from from the campo San Moise. Once you enter it is a different story. A beautiful glass sculpture a la Chahuli in reds and rose greets you, like a giant quivering lotus flower. The lobby is understated and elegant and the reception staff is gracious. We stayed for 2 nights post cruise and were pleasantly surprised. Our room was a Deluxe and overlooked a small canal and rooftops. It was very quiet and spacious and well appointed. Breakfast was a delight on the De Pisis restaurant overlooking the Grand Canal, just across from La Salute Church and the new Pinault Collection, (A must See). The Bauer connects with the Palazzo which is much pricier, but shares the restaurants. Just outside the Bauer entrance is Campo San Moises and it's very Baroque church and on the right the most expensive shopping in Venice. Every top designer is there, along with the corresponding knockoffs just in front of the stores. (I was warned not to buy from these fellas it is against the law and you the tourist can be fined. The hard part is not letting them see that you are looking at the handbags,because if you do then they don't leave you alone, and some of the bags look awfully good.) Continue walking and you will follow the crowds to San Marco. If you go left you will after several bridges end up at La Academia bridge and a whole other world. Take the vaporetto to Rialto and just enjoy the sights. You just cannot beat the location. Can you tell that I love Venice? I would never have picked the Bauer based on the exterior, but it was part of a cruise package and I am very glad we stayed there. The service was very good and the room was too.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, great service,stunning location in the heart of Venice and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: we-have-a-pet-dog
Reviews.Content: Check in was efficient and quick. Staff are multi-lingual which made check-in easy. Foyer of hotel was stunning with lovely art work pieces on display. We had a standard room which was small and at night very stuffy as no air seemed to circulate. However the room itself was very clean and beautifu. We had booked a room for 3 which was a bit crowded with a double bed (2 singles joined together) and a foldout bed for my teenage son (would have been nice to provide a single bed for him rather than a fold out bed seeing as we paid for 3. Bathroom was nice and very clean. Room cleaning staff did an exemplary job of cleaning. Unfortunately the beds were very hard. Evening 'turn down' room staff were wonderful. Turning bed covers down and attention to the smaller things that make the hotel stay wonderful. Breakfast was fantastic, such a huge range of fresh fruits, pastries, cereals and hot foods. Individual waiters serving you with whatever hot beverage you would like (the hot chocolates were delicious). Gorgeous views of the canal while eating breakfast (unfortunately it was too cold, being winter time, to eat outdoors on the terrace). Outside the hotel were many souvenir shops and nearby some wonderful eating places (including a great restaurant we ate at several times called Vino Vino) where the staff were very hospitable and extremely friendly and the food truly delicious (this restaurant came on recommendation to us from the concierge at our hotel). One late evening we had hot chocolate, coffee and cake for supper at our hotel, and the prices charged were extremely expensive (came as a huge shock; the menu didn't have any prices on it when we looked). However the food was very nice. The hotel has an entrance/exit right on the canal edge so arrival and departure by water taxi was easy and added to the Venetian experience. I would advise not to use the Gondolas in the canal directly outside the hotel as they charge quite a lot more for a ride, and the ride is a lot shorter than if you shop around. They wanted to charge 130 Euros for 40 minutes, and we ended up getting a one hour ride for 100 Euros from a Gondoleer in the main lagoon near the main Plaza (St. Marks). Shop around before you go for a Gondola ride. Venice is a truly wonderful place to visit. Make sure you select a great hotel as it can truly make a difference to your stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome is what we received.”
Reviews.Author: wonderfulmemories
Reviews.Content: One of the reasons we choose this hotel out of the many you view on the website, was the prompt reply to our enquiry and the locaton. On arrival we were 30 minutes too early for check-in but was asked to wait a short while which they gave us complimentry drinks/snacks.They upgraded our daughters room to a suite (which included a spa) and this was a nice surprise. The hotel staff that we dealt with all spoke English, extremely well groomed and presented themselves with a friendly attitude even when they were busy.

Reviews.Title: “One word: FANTASTICO!”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter880
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™m a new member of trip advisor and I owe everything to this site for it gave me the best idea where I should stay whenever I travel. And yes, I was never failed to choose Bauer Hotel as my lovely haven for the Christmas season. I booked this hotel based on the reviews I read and was never disappointed for it was fantastic and superb. Such a romantic getaway for me and my partner. For 4 days and 3 nights, a suite room was given to me. It was expensive, a lot expensive as I wish to say, but the time I stepped into my room, I was just overwhelmed. Itâ€™s worth every penny or Euros indeed. The price is high but itâ€™s fairly competitive. Excellent location. Just a few steps to St. Marks, La Fenice and shopping boutiques as well. The breakfast was my favorite ---truly the best thing to start the day. The idea of serving it on the terrace overlooking the Grand Canal was excellent. Other hotels in Venice should do this as well. It gives you a very relaxing feeling. All hotel staff is friendly and professional. You can really feel the sincerity with their smiles and I guess this makes the guests come back. Applause to the management. Will be back here for sure. And hey, have I mentioned that they also have an impressive reception. Very well-designed. I love everything about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Just Not as Great as the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: ancPR
Reviews.Content: We loved the Bauer Hotel. The room and bathroom were huge (we requested and got an accessible room). However, after staying at the Palazzo on a previous occasion, I could understand why the Palazzo is so much more expensive. The beds and pillows at the Bauer are like concrete! Too bad. However, the service, as always, was superb. I recommend that any person with disabilities request that the vaporetto leave you at the Palazzo pier since it is much more secure than the Bauer pier.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated Bauer”
Reviews.Author: beachbug
Reviews.Content: This hotel was simply superb. I picked it based on the great rate I got through the Leading Hotels website and was somewhat hesitant due to the reviews on this site. Now, to be fair, my room got upgraded because I am a member of leader's club. I understand that there is an older wing where maybe the rooms are not as nice. I had a room in the renovated portion with a view of a side canal. The room itself was beautiful and the bathroom a pleasure after having just spent 7 nights on a cruise ship. The location was perfect and only a short walk to St. Marks and La Fenice. Concierge was very helpful and service prompt. The only issue I had was when I wanted to check in early and they said the room would not be ready until after check in time due to "high occupancy". Now, I was there is mid November - hardly high season - and certainly there seemed to be hardly anyone at the hotel. In any event, I pushed a little and they got me the room. The front desk was actually very helpful and I won't be critical. The breakfast alone is reason enough to stay at this hotel. I LOVE the breakfast here. The views from the restaurant of the Grand Canal are perfect and they have the best sliced prosciutto I have ever had! In the warmer months they have prime canal front dining which I imagine must be amazing. To sit and have that breakfast and then get whisked away in a private water taxi to the airport was the perfect way to end my trip. Overall, this hotel is fantastic. I loved that it was sophisticated and modern. Every time I stay at leading hotels in Europe I always come away thinking that the hotels are stuck in some earlier era and need a major facelift. Not this one. With this hotel you get the elegance of Venice with modern comforts. Definitely my top pick for Venice and I hope to re-visit it some day. One note for the opera buffs out there - unlike La Scala, La Fenice does not have subtitles. If you don't speak Italian make sure you know the story of the opera you are seeing ahead of time!

Reviews.Title: “Atmosphere in abundance”
Reviews.Author: CorinthianLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at what was then called the Bauer Grunewald with my parents many years ago and decided to stay again to see how much it had changed. Found a good deal with Expedia and can whole-heartedly recommend the hotel under its new ownership and management. Had one of the older rooms but well-maintained and elegant in a classic '50s Venetian style. The public rooms with Venetian glass and wood are unchanged and have an enduring glamour. Restaurant terrace on the ground floor is a magical place for breakfast with possibly the best view in Venice (so much better than the Danieli) giving a real sense of the morning bustle on the Grand Canal. Very busy and sometimes chaotic trying to get a table, but you can also use the top-floor terrace restaurant which as amazing views (the highest public terrace in the city). Birds flitting around the pergola whilst you look out towards San Giorgio M. Would recommend to anyone wanting to find a little quiet in a hectic city.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Shivvy68
Reviews.Content: The Bauer hotel gets a bit of an unfair review in most travel books - often referred to as a modern monstrosity; however, that's more than a bit unfair. Yes, it's modern but it doesn't encroach on its space and is fairly unpretentious from the outside. Its location is second to none - overlooking the Grande Canal and a small side canal, and just 5 mins walk from the Piazzo San Marco. Drinks/breakfast/dinner can be enjoyed on the terrace with the most spectacular view. Yes, like most hotels of this rating - its expensive to stay, eat and drink but for a special occasion then absolutely worth it, although we didn't eat dinner there, so I can't vouch for that. Make sure you opt for bed and breakfast as the breakfast is superb and costs Euro50 plus per person if you pay separately. We spent a long weekend here to celebrate our first wedding anniversary - we were given a complimentary bottle of bubbly and a room upgrade (room with a great view over the Piazzo San Marco and the Grande Canal). The staff were generally very polite, although the concierge service wasn't particularly helpful. We didn't accept the hotel transportation from the airport to their private jetty, as this would have cost an extra Euro180 by water taxi - we opted for the water bus, much cheaper (circa Euro27 total), dropping us off in St Mark's, just a 5 minute walk from the hotel. We knew Vevnice was going to be expensive - but as it was a special occasion and on my list of places to see before I die, it was worth every penny (or hundreds of Euros)!

Reviews.Title: “Despite the frayed edges...We Liked It”
Reviews.Author: DCJay
Reviews.Content: We stayed a couple of nights at the Bauer - it's definitely time for a re-fresh of the rooms, lobby and exterior. First impressions being what they are, the carpet on the floor of the revolving door is worn, noticed a torn and flapping awning when next door at the Feragamo store and the room was clean but dated - water leaked from the shower. Excellent concierge with Marco, great restaurant recommendations and very helpful with guidance. Very clean rooms and great water pressure! Excellent location for everything Venice has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Good but could be better.”
Reviews.Author: berhala236
Reviews.Content: The Bauer is somewhat unique in Venice for having a modern front. Reportedly renovated in the late 1990s, I love the modern light fittings, and the water pressure. But the shower unit in 240 needs to be replaced: i) water tends to stand in the shower base and ii) it just looked unappealing with the buildup of calcification on the showerhead and its grey colouring. We decided not to use it and opted for the hand-held shower that came with the jacuzzi bath-tub. The room size of 240 was tremendous, and the view from its various balconies was wonderful. We landed up having room service during two nights of our stay which was excellent, as was the buffet breakfast each morning. Our breakfast was included with the room otherwise it would have been â‚¬50 per person, which is pretty steep even if champagne is on offer. What I did not like was the restriction of Room Service or any kind of dining being available only from 7 pm on. Housekeeping in the evenings would enter even when there were people in the room which is just plain odd. There is no place quite like Venice and the city appears to know this, so that it has absolutely no qualms about how it treats tourists. It starts with the water taxis' and extends to its eateries. I did not like Venice in 2008 when I visited because I felt it was a city that robbed its greatest source of income â€“ the tourists â€“ blind; and my opinion is little changed. The Bauer is a good hotel but if you took it out of Venice and stuck it in a city like Vancouver (or even Rome) it would be a borderline 4-star hotel (meaning closer to 3.) What is decent is that while everyone is charging for internet service, the hotel has the set rate of â‚¬20 for your entire stay -- cheap if you're staying for more than 2 nights. Sadly, my Mac did not like its wireless service, and therefore only my iPhone got to use its network, which is not high speed. The "city" and hotel were offering free taxis to Murano, but actually you are limited to one factory. Murano in fact supports many glass-making factories, and you do yourself a disservice if you don't shop around. Beware of eateries near major tourist traffic areas that have staff soliciting you to eat at their restaurant as they do not let you order what you want but expect you to order at least one entree per person. Worse, the food is very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy,hard beds,you may as well sleep on the street”
Reviews.Author: retiredincyprus
Reviews.Content: We always travel 5 star and we know Venice can be a bit noisy but this hotel,as many others have said,was not up to it by any standard except that the staff actually did try to find us,without success,a quiet room.The front desk is good and professional but the owners have clearly not slept on the rock like beds or pillows.The main extractor for the kitchen goes up through the open centre of the hotel and works from 6am to midnight.To the east in the alley alongside the hotel is a laundry which starts banging and shouting at 6 am. The worst disappointment of all was our E250 anniversary dinner which was garbage although served on the beautiful grand canal. Go to Venice but don't stay here

Reviews.Title: “Top of the world”
Reviews.Author: Its_Scandinavian
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three summer nights in August. The hotel is great and I think we got a great value (however, itâ€™s expensive but along other 5 stars in Venice it was a good deal). Location is the best, next to San Marco and close to my favorite place in Venice â€“ Dorsoduro. Bauer is absolutely one of the better hotel I never stayed in, and I have usually high expectations. Everything was to the point great with efficient and friendly staff, well equipped and charming rooms, clean, great views, sober atmosphere and a breakfast buffet of your dreams. We had a Deluxe Room in the new part with a small balcony overlooking the tiny canal and lively street with gondolas, roomy marble bathroom and a great bed. Itâ€™s just heaven to relax after a day walking in Venice in the room and have the balcony doors open and listen to the sound of a gondoliers â€œo sole mioâ€�. I recommend arriving with a water taxi from the airport (pre-booked by the hotel) because of the views of the city and an entrance in style. We was followed to the room by the receptionist showing every facilities as well as prompt service by the porters. The absolutely hidden game is the Bar Terrace where you can enjoy coffee or drinks. The drinks could be more innovative but they were nice. Breakfasts are a most and enjoy this buffet with alâ€™a carte choices of eggs by your table overlooking the Grand Canal. A wide selection of fruits and berries made the breakfast as great as it can be. Only one disappointment, the restaurant was very expensive and I had expected better quality of food and service. If you had breakfast every day, and a drink in the evening, the restaurant view isnâ€™t worth the money for dinner. For waterfront views I recommend the Lineaombra Restaurant in Dorsoduro â€“ better quality and experience for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Wrong With It, Just Not That Good”
Reviews.Author: HobokenGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: Venice is always an expensive city and since we were in town for the festival of the Redeemer the hotels were heavily booked and charging a premium rate for the festival night. The Bauerâ€™s location is excellent. The staff and service were professional, attentive and friendly. Our room and bath were fine but in need of updating and TLC. We had a king bed in a very small room with very high ceilings. The white marble bath was nice but when you took a shower, the entire bathroom got soaked. A plus was the Juliet balcony overlooking a small canal. The breakfast buffet was very good and included in our rate, otherwise it cost 50 Euros. Overlooking the Grand Canal, the Red Bar Canale is the perfect place to have a drink and watch Venice go by. So while we were less than excited to pay top dollar for a so-so room, we were thrilled to secure a table on the terrace to have a drink and watch the spectacular fireworks show. All in all the Bauer was fine, but on my next visit to Venice I think Iâ€™ll look for a different place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Bauer in Venice just living off its reputation”
Reviews.Author: shupe
Reviews.Content: Recently, we stayed at the Bauer Hotel in Venice. The loacation is just excellent on St. Marks Square and right on the Grand Canal. It is a member of the Leading Hotels of the World so we thought it would be excellent as these members usually are in the best loaction with amazing amenities and servies. This hotel was a total disappointment starting with my attempt to email and get information. I finally had to call and even then was provided with incomplete and inadequate information and felt like I was bothering the Concierge Staff. When we arrived the staff was unfriendly and even discourteous. The hotel rooms are small and dark. They will not provide an iron and ironing board and when you call any service in the hotel like house keeping it just rings and rings. You find yourself calling the fornt desk and speaking to an someone, who is clearly bothered by your call, each time you want to make a request for anything even something like ice. It is not be a place I would feel confortable recommending to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: shsn
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, the hotel is right next to a place where you can hire Gondolas and within walking distance of all prime shopping boutiques. Transfer from airport to hotel was smooth. It has a beautiful church right outside it. Feels very historic with an impressive reception (especially the Murano glass centrepiece). Staff efficient and friendly. View, not much really, was overlooking a tailor shop and the elevators only hold four people at a time, but since I was not in the room much that was not an issue. Loved waking up in the morning to the sounds of the city .Most of all enjoyed having breakfast -It was served on the terrace overlooking the Grand Canal with very friendly waiting staff. Will come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but somehow missing something...”
Reviews.Author: marleypoo
Reviews.Content: The Bauer is a very nice, elegant hotel in an excellent location. Our room was lovely and roomy and the bathroom well appointed. That being said, it just felt like something was "missing"...and I can't quite put my finger on it. I think the staff, while very professional and polite, lacked the friendliness that can make a hotel stay so much more enjoyable. Perhaps that is due to the size of the hotel. I don't know...it just didn't "feel" like I wanted it to and I probably would try a different, smaller, homier place if I were to go back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location - over priced”
Reviews.Author: xolo90
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the middle of high end shopping. The rooms for the cost was not up to par in my opinion. I was somewhat upset the rooms were not ready to be occupied at official check in time, we had to wait 1 hr. We had two connecting rooms facing the grand canal. I was surprised to have had the opportunity to witness the redemption fireworks (front row seat from the room - major plus) The bed was lumpy and the room not that comfortable. The hotel staff was nice and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good overall experience but missing the wow factor!”
Reviews.Author: Murphino
Reviews.Content: Reservation - The Bauer hotel came recommended by a friend. My initial interactions over the phone were good. The agent was very professional and my request for an upgrade was granted which I found a nice gesture. This however was tainted by the fact that our room (Casa Nova Suite) was in another building adjacent to the Bauer Hotel and not the hotel itself. This was quite disappointing however all hotel facilities were on offer and it was only 20 metres away. This however should be very clearly indicated when booking. Location- The hotel is very centrally located and only a stone's throw from St. Marcos square. You access it by water taxi â‚¬60 or water bus â‚¬6.50. There are lots of Ristorantes and exclusive shopping nearby. Room- The room was very well appointed with a decent sized bathroom, bath and shower. The room itself was large (30m2), as was the bed however there was a large ridge in the centre of the bed (two beds joined together) which wasn't very comfortable. As a Leading Hotels of the World member, the hotel was true to the classical style accustomed to this group, strong patterned room decor with old world furniture or Venetian style as it was described by the hotels reception staff. The room was fitted with all luxuries associated with a five star luxury hotel. There was however no iron and at â‚¬6.50 to press a polo shirt and the pressing service open only during the day, I wasn't very impressed.
