The room had no views and alluded even the slightest glimpse of Venetian architecture or waterway, disappointing given you are surrounded by it everywhere else. Despite the above, the room was large, well furnished and comfortable. Food- Whilst we only had breakfast (not sure of the lunch or dinner quality), the food was at best average for a hotel of this standard. The breakfast charge of â‚¬50 per person was expensive (although included in our rate) and to be honest it did not match up to our expectation. The breakfast terrace was picturesque overlooking the grand canal and was beautiful in the morning. The pastries\bread were not as fresh as one would expect and it would have been nice to have a toaster and more choice on the buffet. Service & Staff- My only gripe is when I called reception with a query which was meant for concierge, rather than put me through I was told to contact them directly, not typical of five star service. Overall though we found the staff to be very professional, courteous and well presented. Overall- I would recommend this well run classical style hotel. It was well located and the staff were well trained and on the ball. I was particularly impressed by the Concierge who informed us well. There are little changes that need to happen in their breakfast offering and to be fair, we were given a rate of â‚¬200 for a suite including breakfast in high season which was good value. At full rates however I would think twice.

Reviews.Title: “Bad room, bad service.”
Reviews.Author: bjilek
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Bauer on our Italy trip with Gate 1 Travel as the "A" upgrade thinking this would be a first-class hotel. There was nothing first class about the service received or room itself. Even though it was the off season and nobody was at the hotel, they gave us a room facing a brick wall literally just a few feet away. Might as well have put us in a tomb. More disturbing was the service. As with all the hotels using Gate 1 Travel, we had paid for a buffet breakfast. However, nobody at the Hotel Bauer seemed to know what was included even though obviously many other travelers using Gate 1 had stayed there. In any case, when we checked in the snotty people at the front desk told us breakfast was not part of our reservation and wanted us to pay $30 Euros each for some eggs, bacon, etc. We explained it was as with every other hotel we had stayed at. We provided Gate 1's contact information and asked they call to clear it up so we could have the buffet we paid for the next morning. By the time the hotel figured out they were wrong and we were indeed supposed to have received the buffet, it was over. No explanation was given for their incompetence and certainly no refund either from the Hotel or Gate 1. The only positive about this hotel is the convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel in an amazing city”
Reviews.Author: Ayrshire999
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fantastic 3 night stay in the Bauer Hotel. There are 3 'parts' to this Hotel - Il Palazzo (the original and most expensive part of the building overlooking the Grand Canal), L'Hotel (the 1940's section adjoining the rear of Il Palazzo overlooking a side canal and square) and Casanova (an annexe adjacent to the Hotel). We stayed in the 1940's section - a little cheaper than Il Palazzo, but essentially the same building. We had booked a 'deluxe room with a panoramic view' and upon arrival, were invited to view a selection of rooms to see which one we would prefer - not an easy task as each room offered something a little different from the others and all were well equipped to the extent of having scented toilet tissue! Eventually, we decided upon a room on the 4th floor, complete with its own good sized terrace overlooking S. MoisÃ¨ square. When attempting to decide upon our preferred room, my partner mentioned, â€˜itâ€™s your birthday and your decisionâ€™ and minutes after settling into our room, complimentary champagne arrived. On the first evening, we had a thoroughly disappointing and over-priced meal at the famous Harryâ€™s Bar, which is close to the Hotel. On the subsequent evening, we decided to try the Hotelâ€™s restaurant, De Pisis. We were seated at a table overlooking the Grand Canal and the evening could not have been more perfect. The food was utterly divine and the service second to none â€“ attentive, but never invasive. It was simply a most memorable evening. We enjoyed our evening so much that we decided to enjoy the experience again on our third night. On making the second reservation, the MaÃ®tre dâ€™ offered to reserve the same table for us and, again we had a sublime evening. Thankfully, breakfast was included within our room rate as, at 50 euros per person, it is expensive. There was a wide range of to choose from, including bottles of chilled Prosecco if you felt like an early morning tipple! Lunch and a bottle of wine on the Bar Terrace was also a thoroughly enjoyable experience, watching the hustle and bustle of the Grand Canal. The only criticism is possibly the in room air-conditioning. Whilst, the weather was warm during our trip, it was certainly not mid-summer temperatures, but the air conditioning unit blew warm air despite turning it to the lowest setting. Each unit seems to be independent as opposed to a central system and they probably need topped up with refrigerant. I could imagine in the height of summer the rooms may be unbearably hot. Our favourite Hotel has always been the Dorchester in London and The Bauer could be described as a Venetian version of the Dorchester. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “elegant old world luxury”
Reviews.Author: Qtips
Reviews.Content: I did ot have an upgraded room, but still had partial canal view and city view. Brocade and other luxururious fabrics on beds and chairs. Could have stayed in the bathroom forever. While sitting in a sitting room, a party from the middle east came in, all in traditional dress, very Chic sheik!! Loved the view over the canal at breakfast. A true splurge for me.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience but beware of the extras!!”
Reviews.Author: SueFirth
Reviews.Content: Arrived by water taxi and greated by very friendly staff. Luggage immediately taken to our room. We were not sure what to expect with the room as we had done a deal and thought we might be put in an annex somewhere! No need to worry the room was spacious, light and very comfortable. The bathroom was superb. Breakfast was excellent and all the better as this was negotiated in the price. However..............................be aware of the extra cost of drinks and snacks. The charges for these are outrages. Everwhere you go in Venice you have to pay a fortune for drinks and meals and the Bauer is no exception. This is our second visit to Venice and we love it. Go with an open mind and count the cost, on your return home!

Reviews.Title: “Truely 5 Star Experience”
Reviews.Author: BinduM
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Bauer for 2 nights with my 2 teenage daughters (12 & 15). The staff at the Bauer went out of their way to help me my husband could not join me on this part of my Italy trip, as he had a delay in getting his visa. We had booked 2 rooms at the main hotel, but as I was alone with my children I only needed one. The staff very kindly put me in a suite at the Bauer Casa Nova right next door and charged me the same rate without any fuss or penalty. The Hotel is gorgeous right next to a main gondola stop and right in the center of the prime shopping. San Marco Square is also just a few minutes walk. I was considering a hotel off the main Island but I'm glad I did not as going back and forth on the ferry is tiring and little confusing when you have so little time in Venice. The Bauer has its own dock so you can arrive in style on a private water taxi (worth the 100 Euros) after getting off a long flight from Bombay via London. My husband finally joined me the day I was leaving. I told him to take the public ferry as he was alone. Unfortunately, he took the slow boat and it took him over an hour to reach while speedboat took 20 minutes. The public ferry also stops 1 block away from Bauer you just have to make sure you get on the right(fast) one. We met in Venice for lunch, then took the water taxi to the rail station to catch a train(www.trenitalia.com) to Florence. Once we were on the train my older daughter realized that she had left her Ipod in the lobby of the hotel. At first the staff could not find it as they were looking for an IPhone, but by the time we reached Rome they sent me an email confirming that they had found it and couriered it to me overnight. According to me that is 5 Star service, bending over backwards to make your guests comfortable when things aren't going smoothly!!! We have stayed at 5 star hotels around the world so I know what I'm talking about :) The other tips I have are to take a free ferry to Morano there are many gentlemen standing near San Marco Square who are sponsored by the glass companies and they offer free boat rides. Venice is expensive but I was ready for that...shopping is very enjoyable in this beautiful little city. My younger daughter loved Vino Vino restaurant near the hotel excellent pasta, pizza, salad. Also before I forget to mention the hotel gave internet for a charge of 20 Euros for the entire stay! This was a blessing with bored teenagers who need a break form "culture" in the evenings. The Bauer also provided a free DVD player so the kids could enjoy some english movies as BBC the only English channel on TV. We did not take a hotel rate with breakfast as 2 teenagers never get up in time and the cost was 50 Euros per head. I realized that the Italians do not eat eggs, waffles, panckaes etc for breakfast everything is hot or cold sandwiches,& cappucino/espresso. I couldn't find any place that served traditional American/English breakfast. All in all Venice was my favorite city in Italy and the Bauer Hotel played a key role in my impression of this little jewel in Italy

Reviews.Title: “An elegant hotel in a prime location”
Reviews.Author: BeachNut
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bauer is an elegant, 5 star hotel located directly on Veniceâ€™s Grand Canal, surrounded by designer shops, and only steps away from Piazza San Marco and major attractions. We had booked a Superior Double room, but were upgraded to a Deluxe Room on the 3rd floor. Our room small and contained a King sized bed, a dresser with no mirror, an armoire with a flat screen tv and minibar, and 2 end tables. A large marble bathroom adjoined the bedroom and contained a large soaking tub with hand held shower â€“ no curtain, heated towel rack, bidet & toilet, hairdryer, bathrobes and slippers. Just outside the bedroom door, in an entranceway that would otherwise be a common area had we booked an adjoining room, was a closet with brushed velvet hangers, safe and drawers, luggage rack and mirror. The room was nothing spectacular and the rate did not include breakfast. Breakfast could be purchased for an addition 50 Euro. However, the location of the hotel cannot be beat. It is right on the Grand Canal and only 20 minutes to the airport by private water taxi (additional 10 minute walk to the terminal). Very important if you have to catch an early morning flight before the ACTV starts running. The concierge made arrangements for us to catch an early morning water taxi from our lobby directly to the airport (110 Euro). Quick and much more comfortable than dragging your luggage to the waterbus stop, on and then off the crowded waterbus, and then again on and off the airport bus. Iâ€™d highly recommend staying at this comfortable hotel if you have an early morning flight to catch.

Reviews.Title: “Super”
Reviews.Author: EmreGuler
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel I stayed. The locations of the hotel is the heart of Venice. You will feel the history in every details of this historic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near San Marco Square”
Reviews.Author: MatkamiesFFT
Reviews.Content: - Amazing location near San Marco Square, Grand Canal, vaporetto and shopping - Modern facade and public spaces not typical of Venice - Rooms spacious, cozy and comfortable, in historical style - Excellent staff, especially concierge - Good breakfast, but very pricey at 50 euros per person - View from terrace outstanding

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location helpful staff, very expensive”
Reviews.Author: joneseyoaksey
Reviews.Content: 8 of us stayed here for 3 nights May 6th. We arrived by water taxi and our luggage was dealt with promptly. Check in was a delight ! The room was rather small and the lighting and access to any plugs was poor. However everything you needed was there and the rooms and hotel in general are spotless. Beware however of the bar and food prices, they are extortionate !! Breakfast is also expensive. 50 euros for what in the main is a continental spread. Scrambled eggs, bacon and sausege are available, but all of these tended to be only luke warm. Waiting staff are efficient and friendly. For my wife and i, this was our 6th visit to Venice. What was noticable was how quiet it was, especially at night. Venice is an expensive destination and it is obvious that in these difficult economic times people are staying away. Hotels such as The Bauer need to look at there pricing policy. Whilst you pay for quality, people are now looking for better value. We all occupied delux rooms, which are priced at 800 euros per night. We managed however to do a deal in advance for 460 Euros per night, so if you are thinking of going to the Bauer, negotiate !

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay in Vencie”
Reviews.Author: TeamJT
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Venice for 2 days on our honeymoon. The Bauer was perfect for us! It was our first time in Venice, and the hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating. They brought up a complimentary bottle of champagne moments after we checked into our room. The hotel itself is very beautiful. A stunning Murano glass sculpture greets you in the foyer. You can relax in the lobby and watch gondolas go by outside. We took the water taxi from the train station to the hotel, and it was a really fun 40 minute ride. The walk from the taxi station to the hotel is really any shopper's dream: Versace, Hermes, Valentino, Louis Vuitton, Prada, etc., all circle the hotel. The Bauer is about a minute's walk to the Piazza San Marco, so the location is perfect, especially if you are just there for a short time. We had some trouble finding a bar to hang out in at night, but the hotel bar was actually really full and there was a great band playing cover songs, so it made for a really fun night. We would definitely stay here again. I also should note that we booked the hotel through Jetsetter.com and got a great deal on our room and saved lots of money.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for unwelcome reception staff!”
Reviews.Author: AilsaPerth_Scotland
Reviews.Content: Booked in here as special treat for our 30th wedding anniversary. The hotel was wonderful, breakfast staff delightful, and concierge, Marco, bent over backwards to give us great advice re the sights to be seen, and at what time of the day to avoid queues and crowds. However, James on reception, our first point of contact with the hotel, has a very long nose down which he looked at us. He sneered so much at us that we almost turned round and left! I don't know what his problem is but he should get over it and remember that people who have travelled three days by train (1st class) expect to be welcomed. We certainly weren't. The biggest plus point for the hotel is its location. We managed to sit on the terrace overlooking the junction of the Grand Canal with the Lagoon for breakfast two mornings and watch the city's commerce go about its business. Absolutely fascinating.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot be faulted.”
Reviews.Author: Neilduffen
Reviews.Content: My husband booked the hotel as a birthday treat, a nice relaxing weekend exploring Venice, a destination I had wanted to visit for a very long time. The hotel was excellent, they upgraded us to one of their suites - beautiful room, two bathrooms and a separate seating area and bedroom. They also placed a bottle bubbly in the room as well. We arrived quite early, taking a river taxi from the airport to the hotel (this a must if you are going to Venice, a nice fun way to arrive, especially at the Bauer as it has a private pier) and we could go straight to our room. Breakfast was superb, and on the second day it was served on the terrace overlooking the Grand Canal which made it all the more special. Good selection of pastries and fruit. At all times the staff were polite and friendly and helpful. The hotel has a quality to it that reminds you of an old Hollywood hotel, lots of marble and art deco, the lobby is quite stunning. The location could not be better, very close to St Marc's square. Overall a really enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Chris711SF
Reviews.Content: We had a good Expedia rate for a room in the Casa Nova annex but were upgraded to the main hotel at check in. Other than lack of view (and we had never been promised a view) the room was virtually perfect, including a luxurious bathroom, bath robes, and comfortable bed. Prices at the restaurant and bar are expensive but -- with the exception of the 50 euro breakfast -- did not seem out of line with the market. What really stands out for us was the very professional yet friendly service, which included them doing a quick room check as we were checking out and finding our passports for us before we realized we had forgotten them! The location is also virtually ideal -- close to St. Mark's but just far enough way to not be mobbed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: diasy
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a superb 4 night stay at the Bauer. Our original reservation was for the Bauer Casa Nova (annexed to the main hotel) but on arrival were upgraded to a room in the main hotel. We were shown to our fourth floor room by a very pleasant young lady who explained all the rooms controls, the air conditioning/heater thermostat was by the light switch along with a shutter control for the outside shutters - most useful to keep the early morning sunlight out). We were pleasantly surprised by a complimentary bottle of prosecco waiting for us in the room. We are hoteliers ourselves and expect high standards. The room was beautifully decorated, the bathroom wonderfully clean with towels, dressing gowns and slippers. Breakfast was included in our booking, so having been warned of the very high price of eating in Venice we were very surprised by the delightful service and range of food available for breakfast - fresh fruit, cold meats and cheeses, cakes, breads, yoghurts, salmon, scrambed egg, bacon and sausages, oh and lovely fresh fruit juice, water, teas and coffees. The evening meal in the restaurant was probably the best meal we have ever eaten. A wonderful place to stay in Venice with excellent professional and friendly service. The hotel decor and furnishings are of extremely high standard.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but, overrated”
Reviews.Author: CottonCandy1
Reviews.Content: The room was okay, the decor was quite old fashioned. The air conditioner in the room was too cold, there was no in-between switch. So, we decided to just turn it off. We did call the front desk about it and they said the same thing, leave it on or turn it off. hmmm ... Really? Yep, really. No view from the bedroom. Breakfast was good, the view was there. We joined a walking tour & gondola ride. Rode the gondola with 6 people, I suggest to ride with another couple so it's easier to take pics of each other.

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional service, unreliable staff”
Reviews.Author: rose999red
Reviews.Content: This is supposed to be one of the most important and with the highest reputation in Venice, but that would to good to be true. Their staff who assisted me was really unprofessional and scoundrel. I, as an event manager, recently enquired for a business event to be hosted at the venue and, after saying they put an option for the date requested, they just gave it away to another customer, although we were regularly in contact to sort out all aspects of the event. They didn't even think of contacting us asking if we were still interested (and of course they already knew the answer since we just spoke one day before) as they eventually thought it was more professional to give the venue to another client. I strongly advice all professionals who are thinking to organize an event at this hotel to be aware of my experience. If all other hotels of the same range are sold out and switching date or city is not your option and if your clients really really want (why??!!) to host an event at Bauer, besides wishing you good luck remember to request for a written confirmation of your booking, and hope they don't ignore it when another client walks in after you.

Reviews.Title: “definitely recommended - clean, efficient, great location”
Reviews.Author: Londonholidayjunkie
Reviews.Content: stayed for 4 nights and can say that the location is great - not on san marco but within a minute walk, transport links excellent as can get the airport alilaguna shuttle and the vaporetto within 2 minutes, the square has a beautiful church and many designer shops, can watch the gondolas go by as hotel next to a canal (which does mean you can hear the gondoliers starting work in the morning but it is not too early so did not bother us at all) the hotel is welcoming and reception staff very helpful, the rooms are clean, comfortable and fairly spacious (compared to the usual tiny cells that you can get in italian cities), did not try the breakfast as could not justify paying 50 euros for it, would definitely recommend this hotel and also would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, stylish & perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: CPFCeagles
Reviews.Content: Upgraded on arrival , we were very lucky to have found a good rate at this elegant, beautifully decorated hotel. The room size was excellent by italian standards and the furnishings plush. Overlooking the church next door and the designer shops in the square below, the location was ideal. Breakfast ( hideously expensive but worth it for the views alone) and meals overlooking the gondolas and other water traffic passing by and magnificent views of the Santa Maria Della Salute, we absolutely loved it here.

Reviews.Title: “Creepy”
Reviews.Author: Rnfoxy1
Reviews.Content: Had to go out the door of cocktail lounge to alley to enter building to the Venuzzio rooms (old convent) or out front door around the corner to an unlit alley. View from window was roof tiles and alley. The unmanned lobby was hot pink cloth wallpaper with carnival ( varied color) of chandelier lights giving the overall effect of what one would imagine a brothel to look like...Wallpaper, bedspread, headboard, part of ceiling all beige print cloth wallpaper had identical pattern which felt claustrophobic. Had to move furniture in order to sit in a chair to watch television. Advertisements show a restaurant rooftop with views of San Marcos which i was told was only for Bauer palazzo clients. After theatre, I thought I would have drink in the lounge but was told the empty couches and chairs were being saved for visitors from outside the hotel and IF I had wanted to go their I should have made prior reservation. So, outside guests are given preference over people staying the hotel and staff could or would not do anything for me. That is unacceptable. I could not change rooms because the hotel was full until two days later and by that time I left. It was my feeling that guests should be apprised of this at check in and that the pictures of the other hotel should be removed from their web site since it falsely represents the accommodations provideded . No where in the advertisement does it say you are not staying in the hotel proper. In fact, it states gondola service provided free between sister hotels I wondered how that was possible when it is in the same building? I felt it was unsafe having to enter through an alley as a solo female traveler. I had a deluxe King room/venuzzio. I envisioned dining outside with views of San marcos with photographic opportunities. Advertised views of San Marcos were nonexistent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: stedi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here late October for 4 nights to celebrate wedding anniversary. Had a superior room - no view, but we were told that when checking in. Room itself was fine - a small entrance hall, bedroom spacious enough for two chairs and writing desk/chair as well as large bed - large bathroom, and walk-in wardrobe. Also, attention had been paid to our anniversary and a bottle of prosecco awaited our arrival. I loved the public areas, and was very pleased to see so much original art deco furniture and the beautiful staircase. Service was friendly and efficient - the greeting when we arrived by water taxi, reception and concierge staff, and the waiting staff at breakfast every day. Overall, a very professional staff. Situation of the hotel is very convenient, and although we used taxis for arrival and departure this is not necessary as there is a vaporetto stop and alilaguna stop quite close, just around a couple of corners. Breakfast is recommended - a good assortment, and sometimes we were able to sit on the terrace overlooking the Grand Canal - we also had drinks on the terrace in the afternoon sunshine.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: isa209
Reviews.Content: We arrived to our hotel Oct 10th and stayed for 2 nights..Arriving by water bus it was a short walk after we were dropped off at San Marco .. from the outside the hotel actually doesn't look very appealing as it doesn't have that old venetian look but as soon as u walk in it's a beautiful hotel ..there's gondolas located right next to the hotel as well..the rooms are quite nice very comfortable and big with a walk in closet and a big mirror which of course being a girl i loved! the bathrooms are a good size too...The breakfast is a typical Italian breakfast with fresh cheeses and cold meats and pastries and cereals and eggs etc..the hotel claims it to be an American breakfast but not really..i didn't mind anyway because i didn't come to Italy to eat American ..The hotel location is the greatest located within steps of San Marco Piazza and a short walk to Rialto Bridge and it's also right next to the water ..i would definitely stay here again .. the only bad thing i can say is that the hotel didn't have early check in which i come to discover early check in is almost non existent in any Italian Hotel.. oh also free internet down at the lobby but only one computer :(

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful situation, some flaws”
Reviews.Author: therealwitch
Reviews.Content: The manager of the Bauer is top notch, a plus point as we did have some problems with surly impolite service from the girl at reception and our dirty room. He not only undertook to address the issues but did so in a very charming manner. The young porters were delightfully helpful with my baby grandson and a credit to the place. The position is fantastic, breakfast on the terrace watching the boats on the canal is positively enriching. The breakfast was also varied, fresh and beautifully presented. One entrance is directly to the water taxi on the canal, another directly opposite Versace: if you've seen the ad where the girl buys the red shoes to the tune of 'Betty Davis eyes' you'll know what shopping in Venice is like, haughty assistants who sneer down their noses at your affrontery for entering their shop. Amusing to watch if you're bored! The room whilst elegant was smaller than I would have expected but it is Venice, land is at a premium and buildings do have smaller rooms so expect that. You also have to be aware that Venice is really expensive, not just a little but very much so. If you sit down for a meal the menu prices multiply before your eyes with charges for sitting at the table, high chagres added for taking bread from the basket and for 'extras' like water. One place was Â£15 for a coffee whereas just around the corner it was Â£8. The backstreets provide more authentic food and at a much lower price. Â£75 for a basic salad for one in the main area would get you a two course meal for two in the backstreets. The city is a magical place like nowhere else in Europe. You should visit once in your life and if you do the Bauer isn't a bad place to stay. It is expensive, we did have some problems there but you can't beat the position and if you have a difficulty you can be assured that it will be dealt with.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: nativela46
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have been happier with the Bauer Hotel. The staff was most helpful in arranging a trip to Murano and transportation to our cruise ship. Sitting outside for breakfast on the Grand Canal was a perfect setting. We inadvertently left something of great value in the hotel room and the staff found it and have made arrangements for it to be returned to us. This was after at least a week had elapsed. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Dejais
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at the Bauer for one evening before we left on our cruise but the location was perfect. The room was large and very clean. They also have a computer and free internet service in their lobby for guests. Take advantage of their water taxi service if coming from the airport. It was extremely reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel ((( venice standards )))”
Reviews.Author: omar_alsheikh
Reviews.Content: before you read this you have to know that venice hotels aren't as anywhere else .. so DONT expect anything like four seasons or any vegas hotel .. 5 star hotels are like 4 stars hotel anywere else .. i stayed here for 3 nights in my honeymoon and i was pretty satisfied .. its a very nice hotel with the perfect location .. 1 minute walk to the piazza san marco there are many famous botiques ( prada, bottega veneta, versace, ..... ) right in front of the hotel entrance .. rooms are old and small but well furnished and very clean the staff was very helpful in my opinion .. this hotel is the best place to stay at in venice ..

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Auntbunny
Reviews.Content: We were coming off a Windstar cruise and needed to stay overnight in Venice to catch an early flight the next morning. We chose The Bauer for it's excellent location and we knew a major hotel would be able to get us on a 4:45 am water taxi to the airport. At 360E a night for 2 rooms we were located in the CasaNova annex. We were not upgraded as the hotel was fully booked for the Historical Regatta, but that was fine. It never hurts to ask. The man at reception said "Follow me..." and we proceeded to follow him out the doors and into the small square in front of the hotel. We thought "are we being kicked out?" but he lead us into a small side alley and we accessed a lovely door with our key and then into a hushed and quaint small lobby that had upholstered walls and smelled like a church. (Not unpleasant at all!) On the second floor our 2 rooms were adequate sized and appointed with spacious black and white marble bathrooms. The walls of the room were upholstered in silk and the king beds were comfortable. There was no view but our location was very quiet. This building was more in keeping with "old Venice" and not the more modern decor of the main hotel. We actually felt like we were accessing our own private venice apartment building when we went into our building. We had a great view of the Regatta from the patio on the canal and the hotel happily held our luggage until our rooms were ready (my husband left his blackberry in his carryon and it was still there when our bags were delivered to our rooms!). Our water taxi was arranged for a 4:45am pickup and arrived right on time. When we walked into the main lobby shortly before 4:45 the disco was still in full swing! All in all a great experience, but if you are looking to still have easy access to San Marco Square and want the peace and quiet that is hard to find in such a bustling location stay at The San Clemente Palace and enjoy their private water taxi service to San Marco Sqaure every 1/2 hour.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5* hotel but a very good 4*”
Reviews.Author: CheekerBoo
Reviews.Content: Getting There From the airport turn left out of arrivals and follow the signs for the water taxi (about a 10 minute walk). Take the Alilaguna shuttle boat (blue line) to the San Marco (Giardinetti) stop (13EURO each one-way and you can buy a ticket on the boat for no extra cost). This takes about 1hour 20 minutes. When you depart the boat turn left and walk past the Tourist Information Centre on your right, over a small bridge and then you will see Henry's Bar on your right, take the next right, walk up this street past the likes of Gucci until you come to the end and the Sisley store is on your left. Turn left, you will pass a book shop on your left, Fendi on your right and then into a square where you will see Prada on your right and across to the left the Bauer hotel. This is about a 5 minute walk from the boat to the hotel but very busy when you are dragging your suitcase. The Location Great location over looking the Grand Canal. 5 minute walk from Piazza San Marco, in and amongst all the stores, next door to a gondola stop and 5 minutes to the water taxi stops. Reception Polite and helpful The Room Good Points We had a lovely well decorated clean double room Good shower Big comfortable bed There was a mini bar with the usual Pringles and beer. The TV had several English speaking channels and you can if you wish ask for a DVD player and a selection of films but we didn't take them up on this facility. Excellent blackout blinds Peaceful Cleaned daily and to a high standard Bad Points RUBBISH hairdryer!!! If you have short hair you will struggle to dry it let alone long hair like mine. The view was terrible over looking a side street across to the back of another building but we don't spend much time in the room anyway so we weren't so bothered. Poor natural light No hot drinks making facilities VERY VERY expensive room service menu which is the same as the bar and terrace menu prices for example 28EURO for a burger, 8EURO for a cappuccino or water, 15EURO for a Limoncello shot. The Terrace Beautiful views across the Grand Canal but as mentioned before drinks and food VERY expensive!! They also have a problem with pigeons who land on your table and try and take your food and pester you or fight amongst themselves. Leave a table unmanned for 10 seconds and there is carnage. Breakfast In the hotel it's 49.50EURO - SHOCKING!! Other Venice is VERY busy it's worth getting up early to beat the crowds especially around the attractions in Piazza San Marco. Buy a really good street map before you go, I used the Venice Rough Guide Map which I purchased from Borders Bookshop, the ones in the guide book are not detailed enough The Palazzo Ducale is a lovely place to have lunch, they have a restaurant in the cellar which has beautiful exposed brick work and arches, you can even feed the fish in the Canal that laps at your feet if you go close enough. The service is great and the food is really fresh and local. The same people also run the restaurant at the Galleria Internazionale d'Arte Moderna which also has a lovely menu and location with views across the Grand Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Sandyflyer
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bauer upgraded us to a very beautiful, modern suite overlooking a gondola filled side canal. Staff was friendly, location fantastic, and the patio on the Grand Canal was a very beautiful spot for an evening cocktail! The wireless internet connection was slightly slow in the lobby, but a very minor detail in an otherwise relaxing, enjoyable 3 day stay. We found the hotel very quiet and within a few steps away from hundreds of local Italian eateries and shops. You could watch the Gondolas for hours just a few feet outside the lobby windows! Would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Beware the disco”
Reviews.Author: traveler from Hinsdale
Reviews.Content: We had three rooms at the Bauer for our party of six. They were all nicely decorated with stylish, high quality bathrooms. One room even had a terrace overlooking the carvings on the San Moise church with two comfortable deck chairs. My favorite part of the hotel was definitely eating breakfast in the morning on the grand canal, watching the boats go by and the gondolas get ready for the day. There was also a lovely terrace at the side of the hotel where we were able to sit at the end of the day and play cards, order drinks, etc. My one real disappointment with the hotel was the loud disco music that marred our final night. Although we were on the fourth floor, the music traveled to our room keeping us awake and the bar manager refused for some time to turn down the music. I would be concerned about staying here again due to the music issue because getting a good night's sleep is important to me when I am traveling and I don't expect a five star hotel to try to operate a disco to the inconvenience of its paying guests.

Reviews.Title: “Venetian Expriences 2009”
Reviews.Author: Venedy
Reviews.Content: I visit Venice at least twice a year and on the last two occasions have stayed at the Bauer Hotel. The accomodation is excellent. In the 50 or so times I have visited Venice I have always felt safe and secure but was sadly disappointed this time. While boarding the vaporetto at Fondamenta Nuove my purse containing around $500 was taken from my bag. Fortunately my cards were separate. My bag never left my shoulder at any stage. The friend who was with me had also gone to much trouble to buy tickets costing Â£150 each for La Fenice. We went to the box we had been allocated and unfortunately were unable to see the stage as our seats were behind two large ladies. Fortunately I have a friend who works there and she was able to take us up to the fourth tier where seats were laid out. We could at least see most of the stage but for a six hour opera it was rather uncomfortable. These two unfortunate incidents have not spoiled my view of this marvellous city, but let them be a warning!

Reviews.Title: “Really Only A 3 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYCTraveler55
Reviews.Content: I regret to say that this is not a very good hotel. It does have 3 key qualities: location, location, location. But after that it is lacking in so much. Anyone that writes a review about what a great place it is has never stayed in a real 5 star hotel. The rooms are VERY tired, the furniture (upholstery) is worn out and needs replacement. One night they turn down the beds and the next night they forget to do it. You order room service and the dirty dishes and glasses remain in the room for 2 days. The internet works sporadically. The concierges are inadequate and would never be tolerated in a 4 or 5 star hotel. No concierge would be better than what they have. At check out, they make numerous errors trying to overcharge, so check the bill VERY carefully. Other than the location, there is not much good I can say about this place. For the price that they charge, there are so many better alternatives. Five stars should be high quality---this is low quality.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: LondonJBMLondon
Reviews.Content: We arrived late and were greeted by friendly smiling reception staff who noted that it was my birthday the next day and allocated us a room on the second floor with balcony overlooking the canal and gondaliers! (One of only four with balconies!) We had an amazing stay, the restaurant was lovely, food was excellent, view second to none, and we didn't find it any more expensive than some of the local restaurants in St Marks. Breakfast was included in our package deal which was a plus as normally 49.50 euros pp. We would highly recommend this hotel to all, situated close to St Marks Square and the blueline waterbus (which was an easy and pretty 1hr 20 min trip from the airport for 13 euros, one way). Don't get confused and buy a goldline ticket for 25 eauros from the airport machine thinking that it is a return ..like we did..ooops!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel, close to everything you must see, very pricey”
Reviews.Author: mothergirl
Reviews.Content: Splendid Hotel, is how I will describe Bauer Hotel. Got a great price including breakfast from Expedia. It was expensive but met our expectations. We were celebrating an anniversary and so we splurged a bit. Close to Piazza San Marco, La Fenice, Gritti Place and many other places of interest and must see. Accadamia, and Guggenheim are across the grand canal from the Hotel. It has a great patio along the grand canal where we sat and had breakfast which was fresh and to die for. We also did a lot of people watching from this spot.. This hotel is housed alongside other Bauer properties at the same location so do not be confused about the difference. The best shopping is right at their door step and though expensive it is worth window shopping and strolling along. Closeby are some great small family run restaurants that serve local Venetian food. Venice is an expensive city so just be mindful of where you stay and eat. The touristy restaurants are not great. I will stay there again It is a very quiet and safe neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Leila5815
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bauer was the perfect choice to a perfect trip. Very convenient to all attractions and in the center of everything. Yet it was also a very quiet hotel. I only wish our view could have been better but we didnt want to spend more for the view since we stayed little inside our room. It had lots of closet place and a very old world great charm. I would love to stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but beware of bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: gchart
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in San Marco so there is an abundance of restaurants and shops. The hotel lobby is nice and the view from the main floor terrace is beautiful. It is on the canal and a very pleasant place to have a drink or breakfast. The first night we stayed in room 228. The next morning, I woke up with several bites on my back. My husband, who is a dermatologist, immediately recognized the pattern of bites to be that of bed bugs. We called the lobby and complained. They moved us to another room without a problem. No bugs in the new room. I'm not sure if they did anything about the bugs. Our reservation was made through hotels.com and the rate included breakfast. Good thing, because otherwise the breakfast would have cost 50 Euros per person which was outrageous for a breakfast buffet. Staff was nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Romantic”
Reviews.Author: MumbaiSonia
Reviews.Content: Truly Romantic, perfect honeymoon hotel overlooking the canal. We had a beautiful room with a balcony. Venetian Decor. We had Champagne in our room when we arrived! Excellent breakfast, close to St. Mark's Square and all the luxury shopping. Very nice breakfast in a room overlooking the canal. Professional and courteous staff. Canal cruise right at the doorstep. A magical experience, worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but over-priced”
Reviews.Author: ILike45
Reviews.Content: First of all, the location is great: the hotel is literally within minutes of the vaparetto station. Entering the hotel is impressive and first impressions were very favourable. But first impressions often lie! When I arrived our room wasn't yet ready - no problem except that our suitcases were thrown into a corner with no visible protection. We ordered a lunch while we waited - a simple salad of boiled vegetables with an olive oil dressing came to nearly e30 a head. A little pricey, but still....The shock came when we finally got our room. Apparently breakfast was not included in our rate. It would cost us e20 for a coffee and croissant or e50 for a so-called 'English breakfast'. We were certainly not going to pay that when we could get something much cheaper in a cafe, which we did. Worse was to come though. We decided to relax with a gin and tonic (1 each) in the hotel. This came to e46. A simple g&t cost e23! Needless to say we didn't drink or eat at the hotel again. There were other problems as well. We found the service from the concierges varied a great deal. The night concierge was the most helpful. The one in the day-time was quite rude and had to be prompted to provide basic information. I have been in other hotels in Venice where the staff have been extremely helpful. The Bauer was a disappointment in that regard. Overall, the Bauer lives on its location. However, there are equally good hotels in its vicinity which offer a much better service. This is a five star hotel with no internet access and inflated prices. My advice, try somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “A REAL GEM!.... LOCATION 5 STAR BEST IN VENICE!”
Reviews.Author: aussiegirlireland
Reviews.Content: After a really WONDERFUL stay at the Bauer I can honestly recommend this lovely hotel to anyone wanting to stay in a hotel that is private and romantic! The location of the hotel is what really makes it so wonderful and if like myself you can get a good price by definitley booking way ahead you will save a load of money! Breakfast is quite steep to pay otherwise and at 50 euro nearly per person it all add's up! The breakfast I agree needs alittle upgrading but really if it's included you still get a really good choise also with champayne (Italian) on offer also as well as hot and cold buffet on option. The view and experience of sitting out on the terrace is worth it alone you feel like royalty! Also there is a set up that you don't just sit down you have to ask and wait to the side until they sit you alot of people were just sitting down and they will move you politely if you do and someone else is waiting over at the desk. We stayed in the Casa Nova annex area of the hotel there are 2 area's to stay in the main hotel and the Casa Nova. The casa nova room we had was really lovely so... clean one of the cleanest bathroom's I have ever been in and all the amenities were fabulous very luxurious bath product's and towels slippers bathrobes. Although we did not have a view it didn't matter to us as they upgraded us to a suite for my husband's 40th so it is worth mentioning this when booking and we had a non-smoking room. They also sent up a bottle of champayne(Italian) to us with compliments a really wonderful touch! So I would have no hesitation in recommending this very efficent hotel to stay in you could not get better in Venice if this is what you are looking for also a wonderful little expensive but special resturant to eat in is the Bistro De Venise 10 min. walk the most amazing food with little extra's added really lovely! Enjoy. Also there is an offer of a shared water taxi with the Bauer hotel guests from Marco polo airport very good service, you book and pay for it through the hotel on depature. It is 30 euro per person each way a real gem to get right from the hotel step it is really alot cheaper than 100 euro each way other wise its called the shared water taxi service. I can not wait to return again to the lovely Bauer Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Henk58
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprided by the Bauer Hotel. Though we were located in the new wing we had excellent views over the city. Great bed. And very helpfull staff. Price versus quality wqas absolutely OK. The brakfast was fabulous beacuse of the terrace outside on the waterfront at the entrance of the Grand Canal opposite the old Customs Building;

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel in Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: jlm_boston
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bauer for the last 3 nights of our honeymoon at the beginning of March. We would recommend this hotel to anyone. It is in the heart of Florence and easily accessible from both the train station and airport. We took the train from Florence and upon arrival located the public transportation boat which dropped us off 1 block from the hotel. From that point we never needed to take the boats again (with the exception of going to Mirano) since the hotel is in such a central location. The service was fantastic. From check in till check out, everyone helped make our stay perfect. We dined in the restaurant the first night in Venice. The food was top notch, up there with the other Michelin rated restaurants we ate at on our trip. Our room rate included breakfast which was serviced in the restaurant. The breakfast consisted of quite a large buffet spread with pastries, meats, etc. The concierge was always available to coordinate a water taxi to Mirano, dinner reservations, etc. The only disappointment with the concierge was in terms of transportation back to the airport. We'd asked for options and they told us that the private taxi would cost 100 E and take 40 minutes and the public boat would take an hour. We opted for the public boat and when we got to the dock, learned that they have 2 options, one that gets you there in 40 minutes and only cost 50E total. This hotel was a perfect way to end our honeymoon and we can't wait to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bauer”
Reviews.Author: figaro69
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bauer Hotel last year. It is really a very beautiful hotel in the best location in Venice. The room was fantastic and very clean. We didn't have view but it was Ok because we were out all day. It was quiet. The people working there are polite and serve you well. Beside a canal (you think you live in a dream with all those gondolas around...). Lovely pieces of art in all hotel areas. A stylish hotel. The only think i didn't like was the poor and not really tasty breakfast. But the coffee is fine....The breakfast is served in a fantastic room, you don't want to leave when finished.... I wish some day i could go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: doraki
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bauer the last three days of our honeymoon and it was a perfect end to a fantastictrip throughout Italy. We arrived by boat - taxi and we were astounded by the lobby. It is overwhelming and luxurius. Our room was very nice and it overlooked the canal by the side of the hotel. The only problem was that it was right above the hotel entrance and it was a bit noisy as there was a gondola station. Breakfast was o.k. but the breakfast room was amazing with a view of the "canale grande". The staff was very helpfull and they offered to organize a boat trip to the murano islands for us. Overall it was an amazing honeymoon through some of Italy's most beautiful cities.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: trinity
Reviews.Content: Amazing stay! Great location, service, food. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth it”
Reviews.Author: jj6870
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Bauer and since it was his birthday, so we splurged on a suite. For a little more money, it was worth it. The staff was extremely nice and helpful. Make sure breakfast is included in the rate, otherwise you will be disapointed with a very expensive breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Bauer is Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: kpkphx
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for honeymoon and was fantastic. They upgraded us to a room overlooking the square in front of the hotel. Room was great, one of the ones pictured on their web site. Location is excellent, close to San Marcos and good walking distance. It was very memorable to have breakfast on resturant patio overlooking the canal. Breakfast buffet is very good, recommend getting this included with your room. When we return to Venice we will stay at the Bauer. Service is excellent. Staff speaks very good English and helps every step of the way. You will not be making a mistake staying here. It is one of the top hotels I've stayed in and worth it.

Reviews.Title: “The Bauer was the BEST!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SJMcLeod
Reviews.Content: We left the Danieli and went over to the Bauer!! What a total delight! The Danieli should be visited just for a drink in the lobby -- but not to stay!! On the other hand the Bauer was excellent. Superb service. Friendly staff. Great location and an awesome breakfast!! And the rooms are gorgeous and very clean with great views!! Can't say enough good things about this Hotel. Extremely pleased!!

Reviews.Title: “unique quality”
Reviews.Author: solidred
Reviews.Content: One eats breakfast in the morning sunshine. To one side of a view, past various commercial craft and gondolas plying the glittering waterâ€™s surface, is Andrea Palladioâ€™s San Giorgio Maggiore; to the other side, Baldassare Longhenaâ€™s Santa Maria della Salute. The heave and splosh of moorings is omnipresent and this is Venice! One hardly needs to leave the Bauerâ€™s canalside terraces to luxuriate fully in the cityâ€™s watery quintessence. The feeling of being almost afloat continues as one strolls inside via the bar and on through the hall and into the lobby: the spaces and decor remind me of interior photographs Iâ€™d once seen of the ocean liner S.S. Normandie. Tall, marbly, art deco volumes; beautifully swooped stair handrails; original furniture; an exquisite bronze frieze that would span two modern storeys except that this is moderne instead and a proper-sized room. The hotel has been in the ownership of one family for many years and so it has a personal touch to its character yet one which doesnâ€™t bear a trace of amateurishness. For example, the staff have mastered the black art of being both available and discreet; friendly without over-familiarity. At the base of the principal staircase modern sculptures were on display and, higher up, antique cabinets and a grandfather clock. My review doesnâ€™t attempt, obviously, to score the hotel against some common standard. Of this, all I will say is that Venice is unique, this hotel is unique and whichever details were less than perfect I wasnâ€™t inclined to concern myself with. Those who, like me, take to this establishment will do so for subjective reasons. Iâ€™ve stayed in many famous luxury hotels and, for me, this is the one to which I'd most like to return. Once I can afford it, that is ;-)

Reviews.Title: “great place to be based”
Reviews.Author: katieh_8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights to celebrate my husbands 50th birthday,couldnt have picked a better place. We arrived early but it was no problem and they checked us in at once with an upgrade(free) to a beautiful suite over looking the square and the side canal and gondala station. The room was beautifuly decorated,and spotlesly clean and was kept that way for the entire stay.Great bathroom fluffy new towels ect. The breakfasts on the terrace were exellent and with the great weather awonderful start to the day .The location is ideal ,only a couple of minutes away from st marks ect, and very easy to acess from the water buses /taxis ect. Would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Bauer Power! Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pollywollywoo
Reviews.Content: I booked the Bauer hotel as part of a weekend city break deal as a birthday treat for my significant other. It was worth every penny! Location of the hotel - superb! Whilst it's true that you can quite easily get anywhere on foot in Venice, the location could not be better. It's a 5 minute walk from the public transport waterbus stop, has it's own waterside entrance if you choose to take a water taxi and is right next to an official gondola station. Just a few minutes walk to St Marks Square and some other main attractions (Harry's Bar, Doge's Palace, the Campanile) and is footsteps away from some superb designer shops (Prada, Gucci, Pucci, Bottega Veneta, Louis Vuitton) - shoppers paradise! The hotel lobby is very imposing and beautifully presented. The porters are extremely courteous and the desk staff are very professional and welcoming. We were given a mini tour of the hotel as we were shown to our room and were treated like VIP's. We booked a deluxe double room which is in the hotel's annexe and overlooks a quiet alleyway. The room was lovely - very spacious, air-conditioned, very clean and comfortable and with a walk-in wardrobe. The bathroom - fantastic and all marble, wonderful bath and shower and complimentary bathrobes and slippers were provided. Room service - a bit pricey but a good selection on offer. Breakfast was included and served on the hotel terrace on the Grand Canal so you had amazing views. The buffet breakfast was excellent - croissants, brioche, cereals, fruit, hot breakfasts were available and the waiting staff were very friendly and helpful. We would definitely come back here and would not hesitate in upgrading to a superior room in the main part of the hotel. It can be a bit pricey so it is worth looking for deals but I would be more than happy to recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Dinner on the Terrace”
Reviews.Author: mck9982
Reviews.Content: This review is for a dinner we had on the Terrace. We ate their on Wednesday July 16th and had such a wonderful dining experience. We were seated right along the canal and from the moment we arrived the service was nothing but first class. We felt like we were waited on hand and foot and really enjoyed the experience. The food was also very good. It was a wonderful first dining experience in Venice and we would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: pinkapricot
Reviews.Content: I read somewhere that in Venice, the number of stars a hotel has does not necessarily reflect the standard and quality of the hotel, rather it reflects the facilities available. However, that said, our room did not have an iron and I was not willing to pay extra for the housekeeper to do it as it was just a t-shirt. We booked a deluxe double bedroom and although the room was slightly narrow, we had a small terrace that overlooked a canal which was great. We did not have any trouble with noise from the canal. The room itself looked slightly worn and the carpets seemed slightly dusty. It was a bit dark in the room as well. Other than that, the room was OK. One nice thing about the hotel is the terrace that overlooks the Grand Canal. Nice place to have a drink and relax. The location of the hotel is also very convenient, being only 5 mins away from St. Mark's square. An official gondola stop is also just outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast on the canal is memorable.”
Reviews.Author: vming
Reviews.Content: We had a standard room which was quite nice and roomy. No particular view but you don't need one if you are out seeing the sites. Breakfast each morning was outside on the patio overlooking the grand canal. That was wonderful and they have a good assortment for breakfast. This hotel is very close to the grand canal. It is also an easy walk to St Marks square. The hotel is next to a smaller canal and they have a gondola stop right there. I would suggest taking a ride on one at night even though it costs more. Your concierge can set it up for you and they will pick you up at the hotel dock. During the day the canal is extremely busy and at night it can be more romantic. We were there in May and it was still light enough at 8 pm to enjoy the ride. If you happen to buy Murano glass (or anything else for that matter) and want it shipped home you may want to know that you will have an extra expense from a customs broker in the US. Ours came as a surprise of about $200 US. We were not told about this ahead of time.

Reviews.Title: “5 stars? On what planet?”
Reviews.Author: JMS1002
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the extreme pleasure of touring Italy in mid-May 2008. Before arriving in Venice, we stayed in Florence at the Westin Excelsior, a true 5-star hotel. The Bauer Hotel in Venice is the exact opposite of the Westin. From the moment we checked in to this gaudy, cheesy, 1970's style hotel we were shockingly disappointed. The staff were snotty and rude and acted as if they couldn't believe the questions I were asking. The water taxi drivers were nice enough to help us with our bags, which is more than I can say for the staff of the Bauer. It's almost as if nobody working in the hotel had been trained in the hospitality industry at all. Our room was small and dank and overlooked a noisy alley. A nasty used green wash rag was left in our shower (and there it remained for the duration of our stay). The room smelled as if it has been doused in some sort of deodorizer and made me nauseous. Yes, it is located right next to San Marco Square, but so what. Everything is an easy walk in Venice so location is not a huge factor. I tried to cancel or change my reservation when I arrived with no luck. The hotel refused to let me cancel without an early-cancellation fee and informed me that if I wanted to upgrade, it would cost me an extra $5,000 euro PER NIGHT! I'm not sure if the hotel clerk was actually serious or just intentionally being a jackass (I suspect the latter). In any case, I was not going to give the Bauer the satisfaction of any additional money, so my wife and I suffered in their nasty, hole of a hotel for 3 nights. The bottom line about Venice, is that there are many small, boutique hotels (mostly 3-stars), that would provide a very nice stay. I would recommend finding a smaller, highly-rated 3-star property if you are looking to Venice. Don't be fooled by the "5-stars" on this dump of a property and avoid the Bauer hotel at any and all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: SUZYQ08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Bauer hotel and had a great experience. Venice is a VERY expensive city with many places to stay. We chose the Bauer Hotel and booked a Casanova Suite. From the name, we weren't really sure what to expect. But, for the price we were willing to take a gamble. Even though we did not have a view of the canal, our room was great! Pleasant suprise! The Casanova Suites are meant to be more like apartments. Our room had a small fridge, a microwave, and a small cooktop stove. (even though we didn't use it, this is great for travelers on a budget, especially in Venice) Our bed was large and comfortable. The bathroom was large with the biggest shower of all the hotels we stayed in during our trip. Housekeeping came to our room twice a day. Once to clean and open up the curtains, and once to turn down the bed and put out slippers and robes. All of the linens smelled of lavender and the provided soaps and other bathroom products were very nice. I'm suprised to read the reviews that others did not have a clean room. Our room was newly renovated and was VERY clean. The front desk staff was helpful and there is free internet access in the lobby. Our favorite aspect of this hotel was the location! From the breakfast terrace you see a beautiful view of the canal. Just outside the hotel are high end shops (Gucci, Valentino, Hermes, Chanel, you name it...it's probably there!). The American Express travel store is a few doors down which was a convenient place for us to exchange money and book train tickets. By far the feature we liked the best about the Bauer Hotel is that it is SO CLOSE to St Mark's Square and the public water taxi stop. (depending on how many days you stay you will learn to appreciate the public water taxis seeing as the private water taxis cost a small fortune...60 Euro alone just from the train station to the hotel) Since the Bauer Hotel is such a short distance from the square and many surrounding attractions we were able to explore Venice at night without any worries about not being able to find transportation late at night. We had no problems not being in the main part of the hotel. As a matter of fact, we like the privacy the suite provided us. We had a great experience at the Bauer Hotel. We could not have imagined a place with a better location!

Reviews.Title: “Did Not Meet Expectations...”
Reviews.Author: thebigfinn
Reviews.Content: I liked some things about this hotel, and some things I found to be very disappointing. My biggest disappointment was the housekeeping. I have posted a picture of what our shower looked like upon arrival in our one bedroom suite with canal view. I'm sorry, but soap scum in the shower is completely unacceptable for a hotel of this standard. I found that housekeeping did not really clean our room. Instead, they kind of just "arranged" things. Toilets, bath, and sinks were not cleaned, toilet paper was not replaced, and waste paper baskets were not emptied. LAZY! I'm all for period furniture, but it should not be stained. There were stains on the carpeting, furniture, walls, ceiling, etc. Not good! The room was of a decent size, but I would say that it was a bit "tired" and in need of updating. We traveled with other family members, and their room was also a bit tired. The lobby of the hotel is great; huge, modern, attractive. It seems to me that all the attention was put into the lobby at the expense of the "tired" rooms. Service was inconsistent. I found the desk staff and concierge to be polite, moderately helpful, but not friendly. The service in the bar was FANTASTIC! Literally, a man stood by our party of four and was at our service if we so much as twitched. Breakfast, on the other hand, was another story. While the breakfast patio is really great, the service was seriously lacking. I just got the feeling that staff was confused and disorganized. Perhaps there were a lot of new people. By our last morning, the service had improved to an acceptable standard. I didn't hate the hotel, and I didn't love it. Would I stay there again? No. It was just very, VERY average.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: Logan6
Reviews.Content: We booked the Bed and Breakfast package with a Superior Room on the Bauer Hotel website. The Superior rooms are described as "Rooms with courtyard or street view". When we arrived a woman at reception told us they had good news for us and that they had upgraded us to a junior suite. I was skeptical because I knew the hotel was fully booked. To see this junior suite we had to leave the main hotel building by a back door, cross an alleyway and enter a third building. The rooms were barely renovated, dismal and not connected to the main building, at least we were not shown a connection. I was in shock. I asked to see the original room we had booked. They were reluctant but took us to a small room in the main Hotel Bauer with a window on an airshaft that could not be construed to be a courtyard or a street. We could barely see the sky and did not know what the weather was like or what time of day it was. Yes, the location is great and the dining terrace is lovely but beware.

Reviews.Title: “"Don't Believe The Recent Bad Reviews !!!"”
Reviews.Author: ParisInTheSpringTime
Reviews.Content: "My wife and I have just returned from four nights at the Bauer. We booked for a Deluxe Room and were discretly upgraded to a Junior Suite without realising !! What is good about The Bauer: superb location and position on the Grand Canal; huge palatial lobby areas; an army of professional and attentive staff; very high quality spacious accommodation. What is bad about the Bauer: nothing !! I price-researched all the 5 Star Hotels in Venice before booking and my feeling is that you will get the best $$$$$ value here if you are doing Venice in style and can afford to go 5 Star. Page down past a couple of frankly ridiculous recent negative reviews and you will see other savvy British travellers raving about the Bauer like we are !!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrightonHarpers
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned before I travelled as I had read several negative reviews, but our experience was great. We took a private taxi transfer from the airport straight to the hotels private dock. We couldn't have been better greeted, all staff were very polite and we had been upgraded to a suite which was wonderful. The hotel is definately 5star, it's a modern quite contemporary hotel. The negative is it is very expensive, we had a meal for 2, and it cost 250 Euros. The location is great too.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel, Stunning City.”
Reviews.Author: natashasilv
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Bauer Hotel for three nights in Feburary to celebrate my birthday, and it was truly amazing. The Bauer is a beautiful, classy hotel which is immediately evident from the moment you step into the gorgeous marble reception to be greeted by extremely friendly, pleasant and helpful staff. Our bedroom was a lovely size, and as with the hotel in general, was fresh, clean and modern. The marble bathroom was gorgeous and spacious and contained two sets of dressing-gown's and slippers which were changed daily. The location was absolutely perfect; we couldn't ask to be situated anywhere better. Literally a stones throw from St Marks Square, it took all of thirty seconds to be right in the centre of things. The hotel was located right next to a gorgeous canal full of gondoliers and water taxi's, and directly infront of a parade of designer shops - a girls dream!! The breakfast room was also lovely, airy and fresh althought the food itself was slilghtly boring and repetitive. Luckily the gorgeous views made up for the otherwise mundane meal! We discovered a beautiful restaurant called 'El Forne' which is down one of the side streets off St Marks Square; and enjoyed it so much that we had dinner there twice during our four day stay! The interior is designed to replicate that of the Orient Express - and done so very well - so is a beautiful restaurant in which to enjoy equally as beautiful food. You HAVE to try the ice cream at 'Gelato Fantasy' - the best ice cream in Venice- it's like nothing I've ever tasted! All in all I couldn't have asked for a better birthday experience. We both had an amazing time in this romantic, beautiful city - I'd go back there in a flash - and without a doubt, back to the lovely Bauer Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “unsafe unmanaged hotel”
Reviews.Author: tom49NewYork
Reviews.Content: i stayed at Bauer for Carnival. The Hotel itself is ok, nothing to write home about. I think you can find very easily much more better 5stars hotels in Venice. On Saturady 2nd there was a party at BB, the hotel's lounge bar; police everywhere, people screaming everywhere in the lobby, someone at the door checked who i was after a long queue. The hotel lobby seemed to be a train station lobby. Is this a 5stars hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Cheating with room type”
Reviews.Author: Andreas.Rosent
Reviews.Content: We've booked a Superior Suite at a good price (â‚¬ 320 / night). They gave us a junior suite. After dinner of first night, I've asked them if there is a mistake. The receptionist mentioned, that this is the largest room. Inside the room a sign indicated that this room is a Junior Suite - on the webiste and the confirmation was mentioned the Suite. So in the beginning, the lady at the reception simply was lying. After some discussions suddenly they had a suite and moved us to the room type we've booked. Without annoying them, they would have just downgraded us without any notice. Very bad! Bah! Location is perfect while the rooms are small (like all italian rooms in general and in Venice especially). Bar is heavily overpriced, breakfast in summer on the teracce with direct view on the Canal Grande is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive hotel, rooms ridiculously small”
Reviews.Author: mika75005
Reviews.Content: Though the hotel is well located it is very expensive and the size of the rooms are ridiculous I visited many other hotels in Venice during my stay and I regret I paid for a 5 stars hotels while many other 4 stars hotels, half-price, had more charming and spacy rooms. Be carreful : the managers will promise you a view - it does not mean a view on the canal but a view on the wall of the opposite hotel at a 5 meters distance ... but bending from your window down the building you could see a little canal : THE view My advice : avoid this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Simply The Best”
Reviews.Author: ILUVITALY_7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights for our 10th wedding anniversary, we booked through 'lastminute.com' and paid about Â£350 for the 3 nights (for 2 people in a deluxe room INCLUDING breakfast!!!) - we emailed the hotel before we arrived to say we were there to celebrate. And when we arrived we were given room 236, a fantastic room, huge bed, fab marble bathroom and MASSIVE terrace over campo san moise. FANTASTIC, the service from the moment we stepped off the private water taxi (highly recommended) was first class. Breakfast buffet was included (a good thing as I think its about 40 euros each otherwise) wonderful choice and again fantastic service in restaurant overlooking the grand canal. We only ate there once on our wedding anniversary (as the lunch/dinner menu is expensive but has the top rated chef in venice), and we dont regret a single penny of it, an amazing experience the food and service was the best we have ever had. We would simply never stay in another hotel in Venice THANK YOU BAUER......

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: Cork
Reviews.Content: A Grand Hotel with a perfect location for a first timer. Only steps from Alilaguna airport bus and San Marco. Our room 538 was quiet, large with terrace and had great views. It has a flat screen TV with some satellite channels. WiFi for 20â‚¬ per stay is provided. Friendly staff at reception and within the breakfast ballroom- Bar and breakfast selections are only average and heavily overpriced. Among the highest room rates in Venice also in low season. As we now know our way around we will choose a better value hotel next time and will avoid the whole pricey San Marco Sestiere.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: MASToronto
Reviews.Content: After reading several of the reviews on this site, I was concerned about the booking I had made at Bauer hotel. However, our experience was excellent! Although there only two days, we really enjoyed our stay. The location was tremendous and only a few minutes walk to San Marco. The hotel is situated directly on the canal, and the morning breakfast is served on the terrace where you can enjoy the views. We enjoyed good service as well and found the rooms to be nicely appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not brilliant for a 5*”
Reviews.Author: KingDoody
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bauer for our 25th Wedding Anniversary. We booked a superior suite through Expedia which was very nice but the view was awful, especially for such an expensive room. Other than that we found the location excellent, the staff very helpful and the breakfast very good. The hotel, as the whole of Venice, (especially around San Marco square) is very, very expensive so be prepared to spend some cash!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrible room”
Reviews.Author: philc128
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is in a perfect location, our room was small with a terrible view! For $680 Euros per night I expected better! Have a look at our "wonderful" view of Venice!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, very central and only2 mins st marks square”
Reviews.Author: lol255notts
Reviews.Content: having been to the Palazio Bauer which is the attached sister hotel right on the canal, some 4 years ago, wanted to be in the same area, quite honestly could not see the difference between the 2 hotels, but the bauer is much cheaper. fantastic room with fantastic view, excellent concierge service. Couldnt fault it really. would definately recommend private water tax transfer just for the experience. Fabulous place will definately return again, but not in August, too hot and too busy

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: elmimi
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing... we stayed there for 5 nights on our honeymoon, the remote control for the tv weighted 5lbs! it was clean but very unpleasant for a 5star hotel! the location was amazing, the breakfast was good, other than that it wasn't nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but not 5*”
Reviews.Author: tragril1
Reviews.Content: Just came back from my stay at the Bauer Hotel, Venice, a 40th Birthday present so a total suprise!! Hotel was nice but not exceptional for the cost, as with everything in Venice. If your expecting a reasonable cost break think again. Everything costs the earth!! Its placed right on the Grande Canal but most of the rooms have no view at all, mine overlooked a store cupboard, unless you can afford the top suite you wont have a view. The bathroom was okay but no shower screen so the floor gets wet and mildew on the walls, and the bath robes were very well used and not comfortable. As far as the fine dining (Gourmet) restaurant give it a miss, very overpriced and not good at all. Speak with the conciege who will send you to a great restaurant called Di Forne just off St Marks square, which is worth every penny, great food, good choice not all fish. Wish we had eaten there every night. Avoid the Gondola's unless you really want to do it as cost 150 Euros, water taxi from the airport is 90 Euros each way but worth paying to get good first views of a beautiful place. On the hole Venice is really beautiful but very expensive and maybe if I was to go back would look at staying in another area but visit for a day trip instead.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CoWexfordOscar
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 4 night stay in the Hotel Bauer and loved every minute of it. I had some reservations after reading some recent reviews but have to admit I was left wondering if in fact I stayed at the same hotel! We arrived late in the evening and were met at the door by the concierge. Check in was very efficient and friendly and we were offered a room upgrade without requesting one. We were escorted to our room and our cases followed. Our room was excellent - a huge kingsize bed, separate wardrobe and dressing area and immaculate marble bathroom. It was decorated in traditional Venetian style - some comments on the site suggest that rooms are dated and worn, however ours was quite the opposite offering elegance and charm. Venice is not a place to come to if you are looking for sleek, modern accommodation - the traditional style is part of the charm. We did not have a canal view, but to be honest this was not a problem as you enjoyed the view at breakfast and spent all day looking at the canal! There is noise around the hotel from the hustle and bustle of the canal, but again we found that added to the experience and atmosphere of our stay in Venice. You can't expect to choose a hotel situated on the Grand Canal and expect to hear no noise from the canal traffic - it is fascinating and a welcome change to the road traffic we experience around hotels in the rest of the world. The location of the hotel really is fantastic - a 2 or 3 minute walk from the main San Marco Vaporetto stop and the same distance to St Mark's Square. The hotel also has it's own landing dock for Water Taxis. The terrace overlooks the Grand Canal and is where you have a relaxing breakfast watching activities on the water.
