Breakfast was fabulous with an excellent selection offered in the continental buffet. Make sure that you have breakfast included in the price of your room though as it is charged at â‚¬44 per head if not! There were one or two pigeons hanging around all of which were quickly removed by staff if on the terrace. Again, if you have researched Venice you will know to expect pigeons, especially in the vicinty of San Marco, but they really weren't a problem. There is an award winning restaurant, unfortunately with award winning prices of â‚¬100 for steak alone - however, don't let this put you off. Venice is full of lovely restaurants offering traditional quisine and all on the doorstep of the Bauer. We did treat ourselves to drinks on the terrace a couple of nights - its' not cheap, around â‚¬10 for a beer and â‚¬8 for a glass of wine but it's worth doing at least once.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: AMM2007Bolton
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Bauer Hotel for 4 nights for our honeymoon in mid-June 2007. Can't believe some of the terrible reviews I've been reading, as our experience of the Bauer was wonderful. Ok, maybe I had the advantage that I took the time to learn some of the Italian language (something others don't appear to even consider!!) - however all staff on reception and concierge team seemed to be fully conversant with the English language and very friendly. We paid 374 euros - (Â£260) per night, a rate obtained via Expedia for a Deluxe Double Room. I telephoned the hotel directly about 5 days prior to our arrival and explained it was our honeymoon and that any special touches would be appreciated. We were amazed when we realised we'd been upgraded to a Junior Suite - No. 538 (usual cost over 900 euros per night), with a large terrace overlooking the square (Prada/Gucci etc). Only small complaint was the church bell that woke us up at 7am each morning, but we couldn't really moan about that!! We also received a complimentary bottle of champagne on our arrival. The buffet breakfast was far from ordinary - I have never seen so much choice, from fruit, pastries, smoked salmon, eggs, bacon, pancakes and even champagne. Breakfast was included in our room rate, but 50 euros does seem steep. Hotel is located within a stones throw of St Mark's Square and the Vaparetto stop. TIP: Catch the Gold Line (Oro Linea) from the Airport. It costs around 25 euros each, but we ended up being the only passengers, so it was almost like a private water taxi transfer anyway. Water taxi is good though if you're willing to pay 90 euros from airport to hotel (better value if there are 4 people) Didn't actually try Hotel Restaurant 'Pisces' as had heard bad reports, however, we had lovely meals at Trattoria 'Da Giorgio' in Castello - 12 minute walk from hotel and the Trattoria 'Alla Madonna' near Rialto Bridge (20 walk approx) is truly exceptional (a true venetian experience - not classy but extremely popular. We also enjoyed a nice meal on the Terrace at the Monaco Hotel (Grand Canal Restaurant), which is 2 minutes from the Bauer. Ok, everything is expensive in Venice.....however, for 4 nights on honeymoon, it was truly worth it. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, but bear in mind that July and August are busier months and it's harder for the hotels to accommodate everyone's preferences during this period. Also, don't use the mini bar, unless you're desperate as drinks cost the earth. Buy from small convenience store in Castello, only 40 cents for bottle of water.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION HOWEVER ?”
Reviews.Author: DGH2743
Reviews.Content: The Bauer Hotel is classified as a 5* De Luxe hotel however our observations and experiences over a 5 night stay in July 2007 would place it as a 4* due to the following:- The Staff with few exceptions are inattentive & unwelcoming The Hotel is dark in its furnishings The Conciege service is awful The rug in our De Luxe room(236) either requires a thorough cleaning or replacement The wretched pigeons on the Terrace are a health hazard constantly landing on the tables when one is eating ! The location of the Hotel is perfect for San Marco Square where you can experience the "rip off" by taking a drink at the Cafe Florian or Cafe Quadri and if the band are playing you are hit for the Musica Supplement - the height of cheek ! Given the prices charged we would not stay at this Hotel again but given the attitude of the Venitian Italians to fleecing the Tourists we doubt if this will bother them.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive, poor service”
Reviews.Author: ZadaZainal
Reviews.Content: It was for a special occasion- the 40th wedding anniversary of my boyfriend's parents. What a great location, just 2 mins walk to st. mark's square and a 15min walk to the rialto bridge! Hotel looked extremely nice too. So what went wrong? We booked 3 double rooms at the Bauer for 460 Euros per room per night. So obviously expectations for the weekend were high. The check-in was slow and unfriendly, and since we didn't speak Italian the language was definitely a barrier. Got given rooms with a view of the adjacent wall- seems that to get a view (of anything) you have to pay about 200 Euros more! The rooms were small-ish, we got given 2 single beds pushed together which were thankfully very comfortable, shower and bath quite luxurious, shower pressure ok. Unfortunately every morning at about 8am a maid would ring the bell and try to come in to clean the room! We asked for a "do not disturb" notice but were told they didn't have any. Buffet breakfast was included in the rate and it was ok, fresh fruits and pastries quite nice, cappucino excellent, but it was bog-standard fare, nothing out of the ordinary. There was a spa but you had to pay an expensive surcharge to use it. The hotel also booked us a water taxi for our trip to the airport and quoted 90 Euros. An employee even caugt a ride with us to go somewhere in town. Once we got there we were told it was 120 Euros, in cash, because we were 6 people. Wish the hotel told us that! All in all, I felt that we were dishing out too much cash for a hotel that was unfriendly and didn't live up to its standard. I don't know about other hotels in the area, but I'm sure for 460 Euros a night you'll be able to find somewhere better!

Reviews.Title: “Representative of Venetian Overpriced Mediocrity”
Reviews.Author: goldmbr
Reviews.Content: This was my second time to Venice, and my wife's first. The stay at the Bauer represented the first four nights of our 14 night Italian Honeymoon. I booked a Superior Jr. Suite for â‚¬836/night. Now, I figured that for this amount I'd get a pretty nice room, with some exposure to the Grand Canal (which this hotel does have, balconies over their patio). Nope. The room was outdated, wallpaper and drapery worn, and generally overused. Our room had a small balcony over the small canal. Constant flow of Gondolas and other boats under this room (Room 249) because of 1. the hotel's water entrance is right below you and 2. the public gondola "Stand" where everyone gets their ride is right out in front of the hotel. So, if you don't like the noise, don't stay in this room. Next, the bathroom was cramped, and the double sliding pocket doors wouldn't close all the way, nor stay shut. We had to rig a system using the bathrobe's belt to hold the doors together. No shower curtain or door (very European) so the floor gets soaked. BTW, the bath products are made by female prisoners. Kinda cool. Now, we all know Venice is wet. That's no reason for there to be mold in the rooms. In fact, looking at the blackness around the vents, it was scary to think what we were breathing. In fact, both of us felt ill after two days there, and remained so for days after we left. It had to be the mold and mildew. Ok, for the finale....no free internet. In fact, the Bauer charges â‚¬15/hr. Yup. You read that right. I talked to the manager Paolo Federici. Nothing he could do, despite my paying so much a night for a room. He got me a free drink in the bar. Here's the deal: when you're in Italy, get the Telecom Italia public wireless access. Readily available and much cheaper. That being said, the hotel has an amazing location. You're right on a little square with Prada and all the high end shops right outside the hotel's front door. St. Mark's square takes about 2 minutes to walk to, if even that. The lobby was nice, lots of marble, very shiny. The staff was mixed. When we were downstairs talking to one of the concierges, he didn't mention that the museums were all closed, and had been for a day, due to a strike. Managers seemed to not be so helpful. Sure, they sent a bottle of complementary sparkling wine, but it's cheaper than water. Hotel Restaurant, like most other food in Venice is very overpriced and mediocre. They try to give the appearance of fine dining, but in the end, it's not so good. It got to the point where we just started calling the restaurants, "Crapeterias." Didn't matter how much we spent or where we went. It was funny; in the morning, we found a little town area where locals live. Bought a 333mL Coke light for â‚¬0.85 Later, we sat down in St. Marks square at Florian. Paid â‚¬8.50 for same Coke, plus â‚¬6 cover charge. Gotta love Venice. In the end, shouldn't have stayed in Venice nearly this long. 2 nights, 3 nights max. You can hit the major sights in Venice in 1 or 2 days. We were left wondering if there truly are any better hotels in Venice proper. I had stayed at the Gritti Palace before, and it was neither here nor there. My wife and I enjoy finding the great hotels of our various destinations, and this certainly was not even close to being up to par with any one we had ever stayed in. Try to find something newer/nicer if one exists in this dying city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Fantastic, Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: dharri1
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. We found Venice to be just as magical as we hoped and this hotel is one of the best we have ever stayed in. Its great location means that you can go out and explore and pop back to drop things off without losing any time. The staff were excellent and gave us some good tips on gondola bartering! Relaxing having breakfast looking out onto the water and seeing the first lots of gondolas coming past was lovely. Whilst we found Venice and Bauer to be first class we did get the feeling that we would not be back because you sometimes cannot recreate such a special time - but you never know.

Reviews.Title: “Probablby the Worst hotel from the Leading Hotels of the World”
Reviews.Author: KYJ
Reviews.Content: We were spending our 4 day honeymoon at the Bauer. My newly wedded husband had booked a superior deluxe room with view on the canal. On arrival, they tell us that we are being upgraded to a Suite. However, once in it, the view is on a very dark interior patio. The room is old, crappy and dark (at noon, you need to keep the light on). We complain but they say thta the hotel is fully booked. However, after insisting, they say that they might have a room slightly more expensive with views on the canal ). Exactly, we had reserved in the first place. But it turned out that the room was 600 euros more expensive (per night). Knowing it was our honeymoon, not even found flowers, or any nice details in the room). The staff is very rude and unfriendly. The food at the roof top terrace is horrible. For breakfast, you get for 50 euros/person, canned fruits and old bread. The restaurant is terrible, as well as the whole hotel, which is kept very badly. I would never ever recommend this hotel to anyone!! Old, very expensive, not friendly and bad food. We discovered that the 4 star netx to it was much better, in all aspects..

Reviews.Title: “Find an Alternative Hotel in Vencie”
Reviews.Author: mrdcs1
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend staying at The Bauer in Venice. While we loved Vencie, this hotel was our least favorite - by far - of all that we stayed in during our two week Italian vacation. The hotel was old and run down - even though it had apparently been renovated fairly recently. The staff were not helpful at all and quite frankly indifferent at best. When we checked in - after waiting for 30 minutes or so - we were shown to a room that was small and dark with broken furniture (chair as well as bed). When we complained the reluctantly showed us another room that was of the same size but with furniture in working order. We complained again, but got no response. We had booked through a travel agent/company and had paid for a certain level room which we were not given. Finally on day two (of our three day stay in Vencie) and after much work on our end, we were finally moved to the grade room we had pre-paid for and had been promised. The hotel manager on staff finally apologized for the problems, but it was a little too little, too late, if you ask me. While they advertise this location as being a 5-star hotel, I would give it more of a 3-star rating at best. We did not look into other hotels while in Venice, but I can't imagine you couldn't find a better place to stay - especially given the high prices the Bauer charges.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, room and location”
Reviews.Author: n_j_mitchell
Reviews.Content: We fully enjoyed our trip to Venice. The hotel is in a good location 5 minutes walk from Saint Marks square looking onto the Grande Canal. We stayed in a superior suite which was expensive, but worth the money. The room has a super king size bed, with follow on lounge area, separate writing area and marble jacuzzi bathroom. There were 2 separate dressing closets, an lcd tv (English chanels were Sky movies, World news, english cartoons, CNN) dvd payer and cd / radio player (cds and dvds are available from reception free of charge). The room was a large and airy corner room with 4 double french doors looking out onto a square and canal. After reading reviews I was looking forward to the american breakfast, but I was disappointed. It was not as extensive as I would have liked, however, dining out on the patio area over looking the grande canal, being seranaded by the many passing gondolas more than made up for it. The service was excellent. We dined in the hotel restaurant one night. It was the quietest dining room I have ever been in. I found it rather stuffy and pretentious. The food was decent, although not awe inspiring. The wine however was terrible. I was disppointed with the service in the dining room. Many times we were left with an empty glass and my husband had to stand and reach for the wine bottle. This shouldn't happen in a restaurant of this standard. I wouldn't have minded paying the 200 euro price tag for 2 starters and 2 main courses if the evening had been enjoyable, however it wasn't and I wouldn't recommend it. Another night we dined in La Caravella. This is found by turning left out of the hotel, over the bridge and situated on the left hand side. The ambience is much more pleasant. It is outside in a courtyard. The tables were decorated with fresh flowers and lit by candle light. The meal was more pleasant and the atmosphere far superior. The price for the food was the same as the hotel, so if you like fine dining, be prepared to pay for it. Overall, we were more than happy with the hotel. The location is great, the general service was good, and if you want something special, room 340 is worth paying the price for.

Reviews.Title: “very over-rated”
Reviews.Author: bzeltravel
Reviews.Content: hotel is rated a 5 star but i feel it is a 3 star. found hotel employees to have a very anti-american attitude. first words out of desk clerks mouth to us were "you americans". had problems with concierge trying to over charge us for airport transfer. had been quoted 130 euros then asked for 180 euros...cash only! a bellmen entered our room without knocking. i think he was going to rob us. no explanation was given. same thing happened on day 2. i would never stay here again. extremely arrogant and rude staff. we travel frequently and are very easy to get along with.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: woodysloan
Reviews.Content: It was our first time to Europe and so I wanted to be sure we stayed somewhere central and recommended by other travellers. I was not disappointed with the Bauer! The location is prime - near St. Marks, on the Grand Canal, central for the miles and miles of walking you are prone to do while in Venice. Somehow, no matter how twisted around or lost we got navigating through the narrow corridors of Venice, we always wound up right back at the front door of the Bauer. Having a home base that was pristine, safe with attentive staff made our time there very pleasant. We paid a premium as we made late reservations, but it included the breakfast, which was wonderful! The internet access was little problematic - not quite sure what the problem was but their connection was down or weak or ?? but that is not a big deal. One suggestion - unless you want to buy an expensive piece of art (glass) - do not take the concierge up on the Murano guided tour. It seemed like a good deal - water taxi to and from Murano - English speaking guide - personal tour - all for 60 Euros. But the pressure to buy made the trip very uncomfortable for both us and the sales woman - especially since we were there for trinkets - not thousand dollar vases and glass. Finally, do not eat at the restaurants with tourist menus - the food is abysmal. Stick to little side streets and restaurants off the beaten path.

Reviews.Title: “5*? Maybe in Venice....”
Reviews.Author: A&JWadd
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in a good location just around the corner from St Marks Square and even closer to the Vaporetto stop. Which is great but if you want good restuarants and to be away from the crowds, i wouldn't suggest staying here. The hotel we thought was maybe 4* at best. The rooms are very average with none of the nice touches you would like from a 5* hotel (free botteled water and maybe some tea/coffee making facils?) We were given a Deluxe room to begin with and it was nice, very big but with not enough furniture in, so felt a little empty. The room though had a no smoking sign but had definitely been a smoking room so we asked to move and they did, which was great. The new room was a lot cosier which was good for us but maybe some would have complained that it was not 'deluxe' enough. Breakfast is good at the hotel and there is a nice terrace that overlooks the grand Canal. We had a pot of tea one day in the bar which cost 13 euros! it was nice tea but not that nice...!! All in all we thought this hotel was OK, not great, not brilliant, just OK but then maybe that is 5* in Venice?! The Wadds

Reviews.Title: “great stay they looked after us..”
Reviews.Author: noralondon
Reviews.Content: It was for a weekend trip my husband's birthday. Booked with ebookers then contacted hotel to request a nice room. They gave us upgraded room with jacouzi was so impressed with thier customer service. Lovely hotel, great location quieter area of the centre of venice only 2 min walk to san marco square though. The fact it was directly infront of the Prada store was a bonus for me!! The breakfast was lovely .. amazing views of the main canal. The hotel itself is luxery but not "old and tatty". Rooms clean and the bathroom was new and v clean which is very imp for us. All in all highly recommended .. v glad did not stay at the danilie as almost booked there!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant holiday”
Reviews.Author: Brett1977
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed 4 nights at the Bauer Hotel on the back of an expedia special rate, and also the fantastic reviews and recommendations of Tripadvisor. Our Deluxe Room came in at GBPÂ£150/ night. This was our first visit to Venice. We got the public water bus from the airport into Venice. The water bus service is a reasonably priced â‚¬12/person/one way â€“ you can buy tickets for this service in the arrivals area inside the airport and it leaves every half hour. It took 1hour 20 minutes to San Marco â€“ I wouldnâ€™t waste the extra money on the express water bus. The Bauer is then only a 5-10 minute stroll from San Marco stop. We arrived at about 1pm, we knew we were early, but hoped that our Deluxe Room would be ready. This is the first time we have ever stayed in a 5 star hotel, and this is the first time I have ever arrived in any hotel to find the room not ready (rooms are only guaranteed from 2pm). But I guess it is a trade off as the check out time is midday, which is fantastic all the same. We were escorted to the room when we returned from lunch and a short wander, and had our luggage delivered only minutes later. The room was quite a reasonable size (although I was expecting a little more), very clean and comfortable, with a large marble bathroom and the best water pressure I have ever experienced. The only drawback was the lack of kettle, which for a tea addict is not good. I guess the lesson is, if you canâ€™t afford to pay â‚¬7.50 for a room service cup of tea or â‚¬8.50 for a room service coffee, donâ€™t stay at a five star hotel. The breakfast (included in the price) was the best I had ever experienced. It is served in the restaurant from 7 till 10.30am with ranges from 5 cereals, egg, bacon etc, salmon, meats, fresh fruits, a choice of cold juices, and pastries/cakes too. Donâ€™t worry for those who like to sleep in â€“ there was never any danger of food running out, there are so many attendants on duty that everything is topped up right until service end. I would not bother eating/drinking at the restaurant/bar in the hotel as it is a little pricey. Venice is full of great restaurants, so many will be cheaper, you just have to wander around until something takes your fancy. Our favourite restaurant was the Ristorante Marco Polo â€“ Salizzada, Castello, S.Lio 5571 â€“ this restaurant gave us a complementary glass of champagne on arrival, was reasonably priced, had great service, and even gave my friend a Murano glass necklace when leaving. And the best (in terms of quantity) gelato we found was at the Boutique de Gelato â€“ Salizzada, just south of the Ristorante Marco Polo. Location wise, the Bauer is perfect with a very short stroll to St Markâ€™s Square, 10 minute stroll to the Rialto and a quick 30 minutes to the train station (assuming you donâ€™t get lost multiple times like we did). Ahh the Gondolas â€“ not that easy to negotiate a cheaper price â€“ we ended up paying standard price which is now â‚¬80 for 40 minutes, not â‚¬72 for 50 minutes as was in the previous version of Lonely Planet Italy. The worst part was the Gondolier continually received text messages and made phone calls throughout the 40 minutes and only occasionally included us in the tour. Needless to say he did not get a tip at the end. It all seems just to commercial now, my recommendation is to skip the gondola ride and do something more interesting like sit in St Markâ€™s square and watch people feeding the pigeons. Would I return to the Bauer? â€“ Yes, but only if someone else paid and only if I got an online special â€“ I would sooner spend a little less on accommodation and spend a little more on other luxuries like another day trip to Verona or sitting at a restaurant on the Grand Canal drinking a fine wine. Would I return to Venice? â€“ No. It is not really for me â€“ the weather was just perfect during our stay with all day sunshine and temps in the late teenâ€™s, but even in early March the streets were very busy, and the focus really is on selling to tourists and not the history.

Reviews.Title: “now that's an upgrade!!”
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from Venice and a stay at the Bauer. We couldn't have been more pleased. The front desk staff were extremely polite and gracious. We were upgraded upon our arrival to a beautiful suite. This suite was amazing, more like an apartment with bedroom, beautiful bathroom, sitting room, living area, etc. downstairs and another bedroom, bathroom, etc. upstairs. We noticed a few more stairs leading up to a small door, and discovered it led to our private rooftop terrace. Amazing. We went to a small grocery store nearby, bought wine and bread and cheese and enjoyed it while sitting outside on our private terrace. Everyone we dealt with at the hotel was super-polite and friendly. The location couldn't have been better. The water taxi dropped us off and picked us up right outside the hotel door. While we found most of the waiters in Venice to be rude, and the prices at the restaurants ridiculous, we did love our hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Weekend in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Cody-Anne
Reviews.Content: We came upon an article in a magazine (Marie Claire I think) that detailed a weekend trip to Venice in the off season last year, and ever since have been dying to go. The author had stayed at the Bauer Hotel, and gave us goosebumps with the description of the luxury accomodations. We did some homework on Trip Advisor and through the hotel's website, and were completely repelled by the price (we aren't in the habit of dropping 600 - 700â‚¬ per night for a hotel). But the closer we got to our departure date, the better the prices got. In the end we booked for 3 nights and paid 210â‚¬ per night for the standard double room. The reception was exceptionally friendly, the concierge escorting us to our suite and explaining the features of the room. The bathroom was large, and included a stand up shower and a deep bath-tub (I took a picture, but it doesn't justify it), not to mention the black and white marble throughout. Our bed was in fact two twin beds pushed together (so many hotels do this, it's always a little disappointing), a little on the hard side, but we still slept well. The concierge apologized that our room did not have a view, but we didn't mind. Overall, we were very happy with our room. It was rather simple, but nice. The breakfast was included in our price and was excellent. Great selection, and great quality. We did our own thing for the rest of our drinking and dining needs. Accessibility of the hotel is perfect. Location wise, we couldn't have been happier. Venice isn't very large, and everything is within walking distance, so one could say that there isn't a bad location either. If high end shopping is your thing, then Prada, Louis Vuitton, Chanel, Valentino, Hermes, Gucci, etc are litterally right at the doorstep. St Marco's square is 5 minutes away, and the Rialto bridge is less than 10 minutes away. Plus it is easy to find, it's right off the canal, so access by water taxi, ferry, gondola, foot, are all very easy. Overall, we loved our trip, we loved our hotel, we loved the food, and we hope to go back again one day. It was an amazing experience, and I hope you love it too!

Reviews.Title: “Bauer lives up its expectation”
Reviews.Author: banbury_phil
Reviews.Content: I booked the Bauer Hotel based on the comments of other reviews posted on this site, after shopping around I found a website where I was able to book 3 nights for a total of Â£450 (Â£150 per night). From what I understand this is about the cheapest you can expect to book a room at the Bauer. I even checked again just before leaving to see if the last minute rate had dropped, but hadnâ€™t, so I think you should expect to pay around this for a room. There is also some confusion which surrounds the Bauer Hotel and the Bauer Piazza Hotel. Both hotels are attached to one and another and appear to be run by the same company, the Bauer Hotel is a five Star hotel with a modern frontage and faces onto a busy street, whereas the Bauer Piazza is a 5 Star Deluxe hotel with a Venetian frontage and faces onto the Grand Canal. If you are planning on staying at the Bauer Piazza there is a separate hotel review page for this specific hotel. This was my first visit to Venice and not knowing what to expect I booked a Hotel that I knew would have good central location (which it certainly has), however this shouldnâ€™t govern any decision you need to make because Venice itself is reasonably compact and any hotel would be within walking distance of the things youâ€™d like to do. Generally the hotel is what you would expect of a 5 Star hotel, very nice but does have a few niggles that could do with improvement. I will give my personal review of both the Positives and the Negatives, plus a small insight into my impressions of Venice, to assist you with any a decision on the hotel: Positives: The room was very nice with a big bathroom and all the extras one would expect. The Buffet Breakfast which was included in the price was extensive and very nice. Items ranged from Salmon and Champagne to Bacon and Sausages all of which were freely available. During the stay it was my girlfriendâ€™s birthday and without any prompt a complimentary bottle of Champagne appeared in our room. The Staff and Concierge were very polite and helpful. The Concierge arranged a well organised trip to the local glass factory for 60 euros; it included a guided tour of Venice from our water taxi which was excellent. However if you opt to do this watch out for the blood sucking glass tour guide â€“ they are after your money and boy do they go in with the hard sell. Just ignore them because most the glass that is being sold at the factory can be bought cheaper in just about every other shop you will see in Venice. Negative: The hotel drinks and food was grossly overpriced, previous comments have said it is what you would expect to pay in London but I disagree. I have stayed in many hotels in London and never paid what the Bauer was asking for drinks and food. You can expect to pay 10 Euros (Â£7) for a beer or 20 Euros (Â£15) for a ham sandwich. If the Bauer was more sensible they would realise that people paying Â£150.00 for a room are not very likely to pay the prices they were asking. I am normally quite happy to pay for a food and bar bill at a hotel, even when the prices are well above average, however the Bauer prices were over the top and they lost out in the long run, as instead of spending another Â£100+ at the hotel on drinks, I instead spent nothing. The room in which I was staying backed onto a side street, not a huge problem in itself until it came to 6.00am in the morning when I was awoken every day by a lot noise and commotion which continued all morning. I couldnâ€™t quite pinpoint what the noise was but I think it was just local Venetians carrying out their daily work tasks. Had my stay been for longer I would have needed to ask for a different room. There is only 1 English Channel on the rooms TV which is CNN News (exciting...not), especially as CNN repeats the same stuff over and over again. It occurred to me that the hotel was mostly geared towards English speaking tourists and I felt 1 rubbish TV channel was a bit on the poor side. A bit petty I know, but it did bug me a bit. Overall the Bauer Experience made the Venetian Experience worthwhile; personally I would not recommend going to Venice as I did not like it. Venice is in poor shape with graffiti absolutely everywhere and scaffolding on every building, this view of Venice was shared by others I spoke to. Shops Restaurants and Bars are all very expensive, and it feels as though everyone who lives or works there is trying to suck that last penny out of you. The Bauer will not disappoint, unlike Venice â€“ give me London, Rome or Paris any day.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: ErinMiller2b
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Bauer for 4 days in September of 2006. It was our first time in Italy. I know that Italy is known to be expensive with regard to lodging, but I feel like the Bauer was really overpriced for what it was. T The location was by far the best thing about the hotel. It was extremely convenient to St. Mark's Square, as well as the waterbus. However, getting from the waterbus or taxi stop to the hotel was really trying. For the price, the service really wasn't what I think it should be. On one of our days there, the waterbus employees went on strike. It was really difficult to find out information on how long it would last, what we should do instead, etc. The staff really wasn't helpful during this situation. Also, the room service was really lacking. My husband ordered an evening snack and we waited and waited for it. Eventually we both fell asleep and awoke to realize that it never even came. The room was a really good size, but the bedding, carpeting, and furniture were all very worn and dated looking. Upon waking up from our first night there, I had what looked like tiny bug bites on my face. Every morning preceding that one, I woke up with another spot in my face. I don't know if I had an allergic reaction of some kind to the bedding, or if there were bed bugs or something - needless to say, it didn't make for pleasant sleep. I will say that the bathroom was roomy and excellent. I really wasn't impressed with the Bauer at all. We aren't travelers with extremely high expectations either. The location was great, but that alone was not worth staying there. We will definitely not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Last minute bargain”
Reviews.Author: canyonaro
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 nights with the hotel directly, after sorting through all the usual online search engine and paid â‚¬231/night B&B, for a delux room. Not sure what made our medium-sized room 'delux', maybe it was the toiletries, bathrobes and slippers? In fact the bed was pretty uncomfortable and the Bauer would really benefit from offering a pillow menu. But to be fair the room is not the big selling point. The hotel itself is the star attraction, with great facilities for a central Venetian location. Our favourite bits were the private landing stage, restaurants, Grand Canal Terrace seating and fitness facilities, with sauna and steam room. The Jacuzzi is STILL out of order :-( On our last day, the restaurant room was full for breakfast, so we were asked to use the rooftop dining area. This is even more impressive than De Pisis and intended for Palazzo guests. Stunning views over S. Marco, G. Canal and beyond made this a memorable brekkie! The staff were all exceptionally friendly and helpful for an Italian hotel and my only gripe was their refusals to allow me use their fitness changing rooms to shower on our last day. Still scratching my head about thisâ€¦â€¦ Is it worth the rack rates of â‚¬7-800 p/n + â‚¬44 Breakfast per person? Nope. Is it worth a discounted rate of ~â‚¬200 p/n? ABSOLUTELY

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in venice, Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: venizia-princess
Reviews.Content: We booked a four night holiday in venice in early february and decided to stay at the bauer. The hotel was fantastic! The hotel gave us a free upgrade to a junior suite where we had a marble bathroom with a jucuzzi bath and a fantastic view of the small canale and the campo san moise. After returning from a day out they had layed out slippers by our bed and a bathrobe was waiting for us along with complimentary toiletries. The staff are incredibly polite and always happy to help. The hotel has an amazing terrace with views of the lagoon the rio san moise. The american breakfast was fantastic a huge range of food to choose from. We would definatly recommend staying at the Bauer hotel, much nicer than the Danielli in our opinion. Our only regret is that we could not stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rainjar
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a grand price last minute on expedia Â£115 per night incl breakfast. Lovely roof top views, private jaccuzzi was being repaired when we were there. Even though off pea, Venice was still busy ish. Gonadelas a must, but expensive. Rooms are moderate size in general, but probably big for Venice, hotel staff very helpful and helped booked things in advace. Breakfast was fine, rooms clean. good Tv with English movie channel. Definite 5 star and reccmonended

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: FastidiousZoe
Reviews.Content: Everything about our hotel stay was perfect. The room was ready when we arrived early. We received an upgrade at check-in. The bed was so comfortable, and the room so dark, we slept 10 hours the first night. The breakfast buffet was nice. The concierge was very helpful, including his recommendation for dinner (Olive Nero - which was outstanding). The staff was super friendly (check-in, concierge, bell-men, B-Bar and breakfast). The robe and slippers were plush. The room was very clean. Finally, the location was great. I would definitely stay here again and would for sure recommend to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great value low season”
Reviews.Author: star5000
Reviews.Content: We went for the Bauer hotel as it was central, near St Marks Square and good value compared to their normal rack rate. The entrance was rather Soviet looking and a bit stark. We stayed in room 242 a deluxe room â€“ and it cost Â£415 for 3 nights inc breakfast. (We could have got a slightly cheaper rate if we booked last minute) The room was decorated in rich blue fabric on the walls and gold drapes and bed covering. The main wall was clad in a modern style wooden panelling that housed a TV â€“ no DVD player. Not that we went to watch TV but the only English language channels were BBC world News, CNN and Sky Cinema. The mini bar had the usual at medium â€“ high prices. No complimentary bottles of water in the room. No additional blanket or pillows in the room. No bath robes â€“ only towels. I would describe the room as a mix of traditional and boutique. It was not in a Venetian style with palatial antiques and paintings on the wall, however it was not a corporate box. There was a very small balcony â€“ just for standing â€“ not for sitting on. In our opinion it was excellent value at this price â€“ if I paid any more I would have felt ripped off. The service in the hotel was average. Polite but not going out their way. The concierge gave us misinformation sending us to restaurants that had closed down! and wrong river bus times to the airport (luckily we checked ourselves or we would have missed our flight home). Breakfast was very good â€“ a buffet style with most things you can thing of range of: a range of fruit juices, sparkling wine, cheese, salami, smoked salmon, fresh and tinned fruit, breads and pastries, and hot plates with sausage, bacon etc.. and eggs cooked to order in the kitchen. Jams however were not of the finest quality. Breakfast is served in the De Pisis restaurant (7am - 10:30am) and offers exceptional views over the Grand Canal. This was a big plus point and probably part of the reason they charge so much for the hotel! The breakfast is advertised at 44 euros and if you have it included in your room rate as most do and wish to have it in your room there is an additional cost of 10 euros. The location was excellent in low season â€“ however when it gets busier you will be in the midst of all the tourist activities. Venice is small and easy to walk around so we felt that hotel location should not be your driving factor when deciding on hotel as we initially thought when booking. When the weather is hot this hotel would not be ideal as there is no garden or pool to retreat to. However, there is a fabulous terrace overlooking the grand canal. In short, at low season prices it represented good value for money, breakfast in a fabulous setting, clean and tasteful rooms. However, there was no â€œwow factorâ€� or real traditional Venetian style in either the lobby or our bedroom. At high season I would not consider this hotel a good option. We have stayed in quite a few other Leading Hotels in Europe and Asia (Bauer is in this marketing group) and we are quite critical people however, we would conclude that this was an average experience compared to other hotels in this group.

Reviews.Title: “Great Except 1 Problem....”
Reviews.Author: sammytmiami
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, The Best Location, Great Views, Great Restaurant. Everything top-notch. Only problem was the bed. Very Hard and NOT comfortable whatsoever. Woke up with horrible back and neck pain. Danieli and Gritti have more comfortable "Westin" Beds.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Venice more because of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: brea-traveler
Reviews.Content: We just took a trip to italy and we visited multiple destinations. The best hotel we stayed at Italy was indeed Bauer Hotel. We were celebrating our 10th wedding anniversary and they gave us a complimentary upgraded room and champagne as well. The hotel had all the amenities you needed. The location was superb and it was close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jasper1000
Reviews.Content: I Booked this hotel after a friend recommeded it to me. I Booked it after reading a few reviews on this web site and i am so glad i did. Very happy stay. One of the best 5 Star hotels i have stayed at. Will visit it again next year and book the same Hotel. Well worth shopping around. I paid Â£680 for 3 nights B&B but could have got it as cheap as Â£425 :-(. Not bad for a xmas and new year prices

Reviews.Title: “One of the finest, an amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rhloew
Reviews.Content: This is one of the finest hotels my wife and I have ever stayed in. It's located right on the Grand Canal, less than 1/2 a block from St. Marks square. It is a 5 star hotel in every sense! Room is very large, bathroom to match and in black and white marble. All the goodies such as robes, slippers, towel heaters, closets you could live in, etc. The staff is extremely friendly. Re meals, we ate only breakfast every day (included in our package thru Club ABC) and what a feast!! It was buffet style and included everything that you could imagine and then some. This hotel is worth the price of the entire trip, DO NOT MISS IT!!

Reviews.Title: “Bravo Bauer”
Reviews.Author: RSIERRA
Reviews.Content: 2 night stay. Great rooms. Good breakfast. Great location. Staff was accommodating. The highlight of our tour. Finally got an English movie station. Drinks in the bar were very expensive, so beware. Everything was clean and fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: garpay
Reviews.Content: This was the best of the 4/5 star hotels on our Italy adventure. The room was spacious (in the Casa Nova section), clean, and with first-class amenities. The B-bar was great (live piano and pleasant servers) and the rest of the staff generally responsive. The location cannot be beaten for access to great shopping and the most important attractions. Come here with confidence!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Bauer Il Pallazzo”
Reviews.Author: Pooferone
Reviews.Content: Everything about the Bauer was wonderful - the room, the view, the service and the location. Not cheap, but wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Italia7
Reviews.Content: The Bauer was the crown jewel of our Italian adventure. While we stayed at other five star hotel throughout Italy, there is something so special about the Bauer. Thsi summer was our thrid time there, and we are alreday planning a fourth trip for next year. While the Bauer is not inexpensive by any means, it is clearly worth it. Our suite was decorated with tasteful luxury. Everything from the golden fabric walls to the fine bed linens was perfect. The closet space was more than copius. The best part, however, was our view of Camp San Moise. The location of the Bauer is perfect and the concierge service was impecable. The excursion he planned for us to Murano was truely memorable. We cannot wait until our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “just for the terrace alone...”
Reviews.Author: billinsugarloaf
Reviews.Content: A very upscale, but not flashy, hotel that treats customers as customers. The best part is the terrace right on the Grand Canal, overlooking the Salute Church directly across. Breakfast on the terrace, where you can take 10 minutes or an hour very comfortably, is super, as you watch the gondoliers right in front of you getting their boats ready for the day. To have a drink on that terrace in the evening is just as nice, and the illumination of the Salute at night is almost magical. Do stay here, especially if you get a deal from Expedia for one night free, as we did. But, do not just take the vaporetti and schlep your luggage as we did, to our regret. Do pony up for a water taxi (about $75 US) and go right to the side door of the hotel. The room was great, overlooking the piazza and the side canal below. If we could have afforded a canal front room that would be the ticket, but the price is way above our budget.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale spot on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: multiman
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our first stop on a 12 day trip to Italy so my partner insisted on stepping out for a better place. Unfortunately euros don't get you much in Venice these days. Though the location was convenient, the entrance is in front of a busy gondola station,so there's always a crowd to greet you at the door. The room was adequate, but not exceptional for $500 per night. The front desk muffed our dinner reservation and the staff was not overly friendly. The best part was the outdoor terrace where breakfast was served. The view is unparalleled, but at 55 euro pp we were relieved to know it was included with room. We probably will not return but cannot dispute it's convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Hotel, Magnificent Location”
Reviews.Author: PacificHeights7
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from an eight-night stay at The Bauer Hotel in Venice. We could not have been more pleased with the hotel. The Bauer is in such a convenient location. The staff is friendly, attentive, and they speak English. The hotel is a short distance from St. Mark Square and Accademia Bridge. The Terrace Restaurant is right on the Grand Canal with breathtaking views at every table.

Reviews.Title: “Bauer is first-rate”
Reviews.Author: barbgs
Reviews.Content: We were expecting a first-rate, classy hotel in an amazing location and we were not disappointed. The room was beautifully decorated, with a king-size bed. The room size is a bit small but a roomy walk-in closet with space enough to set up an opened suitcase was helpful. Service was superb. The view from the restaurant terrace on the Grand Canal was breathtaking! Perfectly located, it's a two-minute walk from Piazza San Marco. Venice is an experience beyond compare, and our stay at the Bauer added to the pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and an amazing trip”
Reviews.Author: dolphinmonkey
Reviews.Content: Booked a fantastic trip at this very amazing hotel with Air France Holidays. The agents at Air France Holidays were so knowledgable and friendly! The hotel was in a great place and had the best staff.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to appreciate the elegance of Venice, stay at the Bauer.”
Reviews.Author: formerFA
Reviews.Content: We upgraded to the Bauer when booking a Gate 1 air/hotel package in April to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. We are still in awe of the gracious treatment we received and their incomparable location, including outdoor rooftop "Settimo Cielo" breakfast setting. You look to the left at sunrise and there is the Bacino San Marco coming to life, with boats of all types starting another glorious day in Venice! Breathe it in!! You look across the Grand Canal to Santa Maria della Salute, Venice's most beloved church, and up to the right as far as the Peggy Guggenheim Collection. (You can buy the DVD "The Sound of Venice" at the hotel, which includes this memorable scene). If you choose to arrive by water taxi (which we did not), the Trinita dock is on the Rio San Moise entrance to the hotel. Instead, we took the Alilaguna, Venice's Carey limo from the airport, and, because of construction at the Piazzetta area, arrived at the San Zaccaria stop. It was Easter Sunday morning, so, as we schlepped our luggage through the Piazzetta and the Piazza---you can imagine how teeming it was---our first impression of Venice was tacky, tacky, tacky, one tourist kiosk after another. As soon as we reached the Bauer, all that changed. A previous e-mail to us from Keti, the reservations manager, had confirmed a room on a higher floor; Roberto, the manager on duty, showed us to our room #538 (with terrace view of Campo San Moise); concierge Paolo helped us with directions to the Tintorettos at Scuola San Rocco, not to be missed, as well as the evening Easter service at Chiese San Moise; and, after returning home to Kansas City, we received a personal letter acknowledging our "comment card" and hoping to welcome us again to their hotel from Francesca Bortolotto Possati, Chairman and President of the hotel. Although we've never stayed anywhere else in Venice, the Bauer has to be the best, and we can't wait to be able to return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: Canadianjetsetter
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights at this wonderful hotel. We sprung for the suite and it was worth every penny! Our room was spacious, the airconditioning was great, the decor was luxurious and the service was outstanding! We had 4 huge windows in our room and views of the canal and gondoliers passing by was standard. When we closed the windows, the noise from the outside completely disappeared. The Italian linen sheets on our bed where ever so comfortable and the nightly turn down with slippers placed at each side of the bed was a lovely touch. We were literally less than 5 minutes away from St. Mark's square and many key tourist places. Great shops surround this hotel. As soon as you step outside, to your left is a gondolier stop right next to a lovely bridge. To your right is a magnificent church and more shops. One night, we were strolling back to our hotel, and in front was this lady singing opera. Yes, opera! People froze all around and were entranced to have a listen. The included (for all guests) buffet gourmet breakfast was amazing! Even more amazing was the view on the breakfast veranda! In my opinion, the best view in Venice! I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and if we ever go back, I will be booking a suite at the Bauer.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it !!!”
Reviews.Author: anna9999
Reviews.Content: My husband and I absolutely loved this hotel and Venice. Great location. Front desk staff were always helpful and friendly. We had the superior room with the jacuzzi tub and view of the street below as well as the canal. Great for people watching. Room was spacious and comfortable. Decorating was outdated but that didn't bother us at all. Bed was absolutely comfortable. Enjoyed every minute of it. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and a gorgeous terrace”
Reviews.Author: flosssy
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 3 nights in Venice at the Bauer Hotel. The location is second to none - literally a minute from St Mark's Square and, despite the rather odd modern appearance of the city side of the hotel, it overlooks a tiny pretty canalside square in Venice where the gondoliers congregate. The piece de resistance is undoubtedly the terrace - it is better than you imagine - even after reading the reviews and looking at the photos! The highlight of my weekend was watching the bustle of the grand canal in the early morning sunshine over breakfast. That in itself makes the Bauer the best choice in Venice. Don't be put off by the high prices - shop around - we got a great deal. The standard price for our room was 680 euros per night - we got the 3 night trip for 840. The hotel staff were excellent - courteous and responsive to any requests. Our room was fine - beautifully decorated with a spacious bathroom. My one wish is that we'd had a view (we overlooked an "inner courtyard") but for the price we paid, I couldn't possibly complain. Everywhere in Venice is extremely overpriced - the Bauer is worth the money. I am mystified at the complaints from other reviewers about the decor. It's 1940/50s recreated - lots of beautiful wood and opulence - please note - not original and therefore dated, but a nice mix of original features and modern touches (ie spotlights set into the ceiling of the room along with the glass chandelier that was straight out of a 40s movie). If you want modern clean lines and minimalist rooms then it isn't the place for you - but then again, I suspect Venice isn't either! Just two tips - splurge on a water taxi from the airport (90euros) as the experience is fabulous and a stress free way to approach the city and go to Harry's Bar for a Bellini (don't eat there unless you don't need to look at prices on a menu).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Esquire
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on our last 2 days in Italy with my sister and 2 teenage boys. It was terrific. The staff was very accomodating. We had 2 fantastic rooms that shared a single door to the hallway but separate doors and keys to reach each allowing the boys the illusion that they were on their own. The rooms overlooked the little side canal. The view on the Grand Canal in the restaurant at breakfast can't be beat. Boys complained that the internet access was expensive but really what isn't in this fabulous city?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: John_S_2004
Reviews.Content: Staying at The Bauer was a splurge for us on our first trip to Venice (April 21-26), but the hotel proved to be excellent. The location was perfect near San Marco with a beautiful terrace on the Grand Canal across from San Salute. We did not take a "canal view" room...and while we had no view the room was good, the bathroom was good and it was very quiet which is important after ten hours of walking Venice. The front desk/concierge was always friendly and helpful. Simply an excellent hotel. This was a special trip for us and they made us feel very special.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: penny1953
Reviews.Content: Our two day stay at the Bauer was great. The location is right next to St. Mark's Square. We did not have a balcony or canal view but the room was good and plenty big enough. The hotel staff were very helpful. We also enjoyed the breakfast which was included. The only problem we had was departing to the train station we had to pay extra for a water taxis because the water buses were on strike for four hours that day.

Reviews.Title: “Really outdated”
Reviews.Author: Clemmie05
Reviews.Content: We booked our room at Bauer based on reviews from this website, as well as, their website. The pictures are misleading. This hotel had to be top class in the 70s, but it needs some serious updating. Although everything was still in nice condition, it was just extremely dated - mirrored corridors, wood paneling that was just a bad wood species and stain, dated colored marbles, etc.... To our surprise, however, our room had been updated and was exceptionally nice, except for the bathroom. Still in decent shape, it was just covered in that yucky wood paneling. I probably wouldn't stay here again just because it made me feel kind of creepy staying in a place that hadn't felt the need to renovate their public spaces in 30 years - yuck.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, very central”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandFiona
Reviews.Content: The Bauer Hotel is less than 5 minutes walk from San Marco so is very central. Most things were in walking distance and the nearest water bus stop is just a block away. The hotel is wonderful, very luxurious. We had a lovely room with a very big bathroom. We didn't eat in the hotel restaurant as men are required to wear a jacket and it seemed very expensive. We did drink in the hotel bar which was very nice, but again very expensive. I would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly luxury.”
Reviews.Author: ianjindal
Reviews.Content: Great experience. Stayed with my wife for a long weekend on a 'deal' (240Euros/night all in for a great room with canal view). The hotel staff were very warm and welcoming, and their restaurant recommendations were faultless. The hotel manager greeted us and was very chatty - he was new to the hotel from Milan. The place oozes luxury but is also friendly. Unlike many hotels that are "all front" and bump up their star rating with in-room faxes and other geegaws, every aspect of this hotel was great. The decor in the rooms was faultless: ribbed wood panelling met fabric coverings and venetian cloth - think 1950s major refurb, updated with venetian textiles and a modernist/70s touch. The breakfast was a royal spread and worth the visit! If in any doubt the breakfast room boasts imho the best view in Venice, over the grand canal to Dogana. We normally stay at the Luna Baglioni (which we also rate) but I think that our next visit will be to the Bauer.

Reviews.Title: “Bauer is BEST”
Reviews.Author: ottobear
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a wonderful hotel in Venice, be it your first trip or a return trip, you must stay at the Hotel Bauer. The location is great, steps from San Marco, and steps from American Express office (which everyone in Venice will need). The hotel is a 5 Star with incredibly reasonable rates. Check online sites. The staff at the hotel is the best as well. I was robbed on the train from Florence to Venice and the hotel staff just made everything work; made all the calls for me, upgraded my room, got me new tickets, etc. The rooms are incredibly comfy, especially the beds. Bathrooms are top rate as well. The breakfast, included in room rate is unbelievable!! The best I have had in all of Italy. And don't miss the piano bar in the evenings or the outside deck on the Grand Canal. Too beautiful to miss..MO, December, 2005

Reviews.Title: “Great to be back at the Bauer”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I returned to Venice with my wife and daughter this past summer and stayed at the Hotel Bauer. My wife and I stayed here on our honeymoon 25 years ago. Upon check in we commented to the staff in regard to our past visit to the Bauer. I don't know if this had any influence on our room, but when we opened the door to our room/suite, we were blown away. We had reserved a standard room with additional bedding for our daughter. What did we find when we opened our door? We first noticed the front hall closet which was probably the size of a NY studio apartment. The living room was beautifully furnished with a sofa, love seat, desk and several pull up chairs. It also had a non working fireplace. The guest bathroom for my daughter was beautiful. Marble everywhere. The master bedroom suite consisted of an oversize king size bed, overstuffed lounge chair and a magnificient chandalier. It also had a separate bathroom with full robes and a dressing area. If I had a complaint about the room it would be that there was no TV in the master bedroom, only in the living room. The breakfast was over the top and the staff could not be more accomodating. What's better than having fresh fruit and a cup of Italian coffee while sitting on a patio overlooking the Grand Canal. One part of the hotel not to be missed is the health club on the top floor. Either the guests are unaware or they are too tired after walking about the city. There is plenty of equipment to get in a nice workout and the staff is very helpful. You can also get a massage. The sauna in the health club is a great way to relax following a busy day. And DO NOT miss the view from the roof top hot tub. This is probably one of the hightest points in the City and will provide you with a truly memorable sight of the city. When I return to Venice in the future, I will certainly be staying at the Bauer.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 24h trip!”
Reviews.Author: Travel_QueenGermany
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the new Baur Casa Nova Residence, which is next to the Baur in a seperate building. Despite beeing absolute near to everything (San Marco etc) it was very quiet. We got a perfect brand new suite with a marble bathroom and everything was very tasteful. The service was excellent. We enjoyed our day in the Baur very much!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time!!”
Reviews.Author: Howie69
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Bauer for 6 nights from 19th September 2005. As it was our 21st wedding anniversary I arranged for a suite situated on the 4th floor. I have stayed in many top quality hotels throughout the world in my time and was a little apprehensive after reading some of the views here! Due to the position of the hotel there are NO rooms with a canal view, (maybe some of the standard rooms above the water taxi landing stage have the side canal view), but the suites are central around a main courtyard with no view at all. That being said our suite was breathtaking, two huge bathrooms with wall to wall marble and robes, an enormous sitting room, a large bedroom with king size bed, dressing room, baggage room, electric window shutters and two lots of air-con. The only negative item in the room was the musemn exhibit that they called the TV, granted we didn'y come to Venice to watch TV but this 14inch example could be bought for about Â£10 in a second hand shop in the UK! We did comment on it to the hotel. ONE VERY IMPORTANT THING TO PACK: a travel iron, yes, believe it or not I was told by the front desk that it was a 'law' in Venice that hotels guests were not allowed them due to 'health & safety' and a fire risk. However, I could arrange for house-keeping to do it for, I believe 8euro per item!! Who cares about a few creases anyway??!! There was no noise at all that we heard from our room. The buffet breakfast situated on the sun terrace of the adjoining Bauer II Palazzo was a fantastic setting with a superb range of food, the bucks-fizz was a great way to kick off the day! IF it's a room with a view that you want then look above you and see that the Palazzo II is the hotel for you, (but be prepared to pay a lot more!). We found all the staff to be very friendly and helpful unlike a few comments that I have read. We wanted a little 'culture' and venture out into the countryside as we had seen most of the tourist parts of Venice so the Concierge arranged through 'International Limousine Service' an english speaking driver and mercedes to take us out for the day (9am - 6pm). It was well worth the 560euro and a day I will not forget. All in all we found this hotel to be very good, (TV excluded!!!), and the decor', staff, food all worthy of a 5* hotel unlike the experience of some other guest's comments made here. Venice is very very VERY expensive and I agree the room service and mini bar prices are a joke - but they are the world over. One restaurant worth a visit is 'LA PISCINA' Dorsoduro 780/782, it's on the water and the food is excellent. If you stay here I'm sure you will enjoy it, we did.

Reviews.Title: “The Outstanding Bauer Hotel Venice ItaLy...!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our first room was so-so so we asked to look at another and it was wonderful..The buffet reakfast that we had during our four day stay was really terrific. The view fron the breakfast area was truly outstandind. Watching the whole Venetian panorama unfold before us, from the gondolas, to the water taxis to the private boats, under zure skies, made us wish that we did not have to leave. The service was outstanding, from the concierge to wait staff, made for a truly memorable stay in Venice. The concierge recommendations for food were great. The location of the hotel could not have been better. We would highly recommend the Bauer...

Reviews.Title: “downgrade”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: showing its age..not worth 5 stars any more...should be four

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had taken my godchildren, 17 & 9, to Europe this summer. Stayed at The Ritz in London, The Raphael in Paris and the DeVille Intercontinental in Rome. We loved all of them---superb service, lovely rooms. But, The Bauer was such a disappointment. The reception staff was surly and abrupt when we arrived. We were informed that the guests occupying our room had "decided to sleep in". We were told we would have to wait until the guests decided to vacate and our room could be cleaned. When we finally were shown our room several hours later, I was absolutely floored. The walls were cracked and looked as though they'd been patched with plaster, but not painted. The carpeting looked filthy--hopefully just old stains. I should have held my ground when my travel agent suggested trying a different hotel. It's back to the Danieli for this traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: secondtimelucky
Reviews.Content: I was very concerned about my husband's booking before we left for Italy after I read other's reviews and attempted to change but we were confirmed. However, our experience was much better than others appeared to have. I found the staff generally good. One very helpful man on the desk, one who was a little stuffy (but a little application of humour/cajoling helped here - I think it was his personality, not an attitude) and a distracted drinks waiter but it was on the festival night and he was dealing with a packed house and we had not booked. The porters and other staff were excellent. The rooms are dated but quite charming. Bed was very comfortable and room was dark and quiet. Did experience disturbance from neighbours which reception dealt with promptly. Massive bathroom. Well cleaned every day. Good supplies. The hallways are a bit worn and need brightening up, but at the end of the day you don't spend much time in the hallway, do you? The location is fabulous - right near the shops and St Marks and all forms of transport. Several restaurants are close by (check out La Piscina on the Grand Canal - great seafood lasagne). We did not eat here but had a Bloody Mary whilst we watched the festival fireworks. Where's the celery? The drink was a bit disappointing for a hotel of this calibre, but again, it was the businest night of the year for Venice. I would probably sum it up by saying nothing spectacular but more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Truly the Best in this Romantic City”
Reviews.Author: MeetmeinSanJuan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bauer at the end of June for two nights, and can only sing this charming hotel's praises. The Bauer was our introduction to Italy. (we were with a tour group and Venice was our first stop.) When we checked in after a 10 hr. flight, we knew we had come to the right place. When we got to our room, we were pleasantly surprised with a suite, which had views to die for and was huge! Location: PERFECT! When their website says that they are steps away from St. Mark's Square, they're correct. The Basilica and the Doge's Palace are just a skip hop and a jump away. Some rooms have a view of the Grand Canal as well, and there is a Gondala area right next door. Food: The hotel has two bars and one restaurant. The breakfast, which I believe is included, is perfect, with a mix of a good American breakfast (eggs, sausage, etc.), and a very European breakfast (meat, cheese, fruit). I only ate dinner at the restaurant once, but it was wonderful (not to mention expensive). It you sit outside, you'll get a breathtaking view of the Grand Canal and the Adriatic Sea. Overall: The staff at this hotel are pleasant and always have a smile on. Almost all speak English, and I had no problem with not knowing any Italian. This hotel continues to keep up their reputation of being chic, yet child friendly, and which makes this a perfect place to stay for anyone! Venice is such a beautiful city. It's calm and exciting at the same time. No cars, but water taxis! The Venetians are really friendly as well. I'll returen in a heartbeat when I get the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Bravo Paulo!”
Reviews.Author: annie5m
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a short stay in the Bauer Il Palazzo as a treat for me for a "special" birthday. I cannot speak highly enough of the hotel and its staff. The approach to the hotel on the Grand Canal was breathtaking, and the hotel itself is the prettiest of all the palazzi. The staff are all efficient and pleasant, particularly Paulo, Head Concierge, who can be relied upon to give informed and helpful suggestions for visits, and can rustle up anything you want with one flick of his fingers! Although this hotel is apparently frequented by such luminaries as Sting and John Grisham, we were treated at all times like VIPs. From our balcony on the 5th floor we had a view of the Grand Canal and Santa Maria del Salute which was difficult to leave. The room itself was beautifully decorated with silks and antiques, and room service was wonderful with meticulous attention to detail - there were fresh towels in the gorgeous marble bathroom every time you turned around! The rooftop terrace is perfect for breakfast (or a Bellini!) the food in the restaurant is interesting, rich but not heavy, and the terrace alongside the Grand Canal is the perfect place to relax after photographing all 470 of Venice's bridges! I would love to return to Il Palazzo, and I would definitely recommend it as a destination hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: pina
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bauer from april 25 to april 27. I was a bit apprehentious about staying at this hotel due to the unfavorable reviews read on Trip advisor. I was pleasently surprised to discover that in our case all of the negative was just non existent. We booked a superior room at a very favorable rate and were immediately upgraded to a suite overlooking a small canal due to our AMEX platinum membership. The staff was very friendly, not aloof as we were led to believe by previous reviews, and the services were exactly what one expects from a 5 star. The breakfast buffet was the best we experienced in Italy (included in our rate). We did not eat at the Pisis restaurant although we met other Americans who had who commented that the food was very rich and heavy. We particularly enjoyed eating at this tiny informal eatery named Vino Vino. They do not take credit cards but it is relatively inexpensive and very very good. Venice is a magical place. Would return to Bauer and would definitely return to Venice. P. Basu

Reviews.Title: “Traumatized by mean front desk”
Reviews.Author: Elmera
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one yr ago and had such an unpleasant experience it adversely colored all of Venice for me. Problem: entrenched, unpleasant middle aged men who staff the front desk. The worst one wore the special Secret Order of Concierge pins on his lapels and should've been a pro. We were treated with contempt over and over. They need to get some pleasant women working the front desk -of course female gender is no guarantee as the frauleins at the breakfast buffet were dour as all get out. Nasty grouch threw my map to the side when I asked for directions- he was too busy reading his newspaper to give any help! Liked: location, fabulous breakfast buffet (incl in our room rate), our second rooms (the first were microscopic), bathrooms, bed linens. Also liked the younger 30ish men who occasionally worked the front desk. The concierge/front desk at Il Palazzo was excellent- if you can afford their rooms I would feel comfortable staying there. Disliked: crowds of Venice-claustrophobes beware! and dog doodoo smeared on sidewalks. Liked: being on the water at any hr, late night when the crowds disappeared and restaurant Da Alberto (scrumptious food, good prices and super nice waitresses).

Reviews.Title: “Stuffy, drab, and arrogant but with a WORLD CLASS location.”
Reviews.Author: jonahleon
Reviews.Content: Good things first. I can't rave enough about how fantastic the location of this hotel is. St. Mark's square is literally a hop, skip, and a jump away. Great shopping is right out the door. Harry's bar is just around the corner and right next to a vaporetto stop. The gondoliers at one of the major gondola stops could double as hotel doormen because they are so close. And, the hotel sits along a wonderfully quaint side canal in addition to fronting the busy and dramatic Grand Canal. But, then there's the not-so-good. The hotel is way too stuck on itself and for no real reason. Yes, there's marble. Yes, there are fine woods. And, yes, gilded items abound. But, it's just not THAT nice to have the attitude that emanates from the front desk and the interior of the rooms. In fact, the niceties of the lobby are quickly lost when you venture down the dull, gray-carpeted hallways of the room floors. The bed was the single hardest thing I've ever slept on. And, the pillows were like nice concrete blocks to boot. Our room was large and did shimmer, but the ambience was more cold and stuffy than warm or luxurious. The bathroom did have a generous amount of marble, but the jetted tub didn't work. And, the soap--while it smelled nice--was in the ridiculous shape of a tiny half-sphere that you could never properly grip. Our room did have a nice view of the St. Mark's campanile--which was better than looking at the other antique view coming from the room's obsolete television. The food and mini bar prices are humorous--and I mean humorous: Try 50 bucks per person for continental breakfast--which is obscene in my book even according to the "resort" prices I'm often willing to pay. In the end, we paid 170 euros with tax for our room and thought that we paid too much (even though it was the cheapest hotel we stayed at in Italy). I can understand why others who paid 3-4 times that amount were flabbergasted. Finally, I must say that we stayed at the Bauer over Christmas. I'm sure the Il Palazzo is a little better, but I'm sure with a little more attitude as well. Bottom line: you'll be okay here and you'll never forget the location. However, you will also end your trip thinking that you could have found some place just a little warmer, just a little nicer, and just a bit more genuine.

Reviews.Title: “Classic 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Il Palazzo from October 10 -14. It is a formal service oriented experience. We booked a standard (Some how standard room at a list price of 600 euros doesn't quite work) at a discount of 350. Prices are cheaper in Aug. & Oct. The room was huge with a fresco on the ceiling. Bath was super. Great location near San Marcos square. The private (Il Palazzo guests only) breakfast room on the 7th floor is beautiful with great views and great food. Only problem is the price of 42 euros per person. That's Venice, all the Starwood hotels charge similar prices for the buffet. We heard complaints that the standard rooms in the adjacent Bauer were very small. We only paid 15 euros per night more for the Il Palazzo, that was a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelingDJ
Reviews.Content: We were only in Venice for two nights and chose the Bauer because of it's close proximity to St. Marks square. We had two rooms for two nights. Upon our arrival we were upgraded to two suites (they offered and of course we said yes). I had already reserved two double rooms but I was happy to accept the upgrade at no extra charge. Our rooms were huge with two bathrooms. One bathroom had the jacuzzi tub while the other had the shower. All of the staff with the exception of the bartender were very friendly and helpful. The bartender was very rude so I didn't go back to the bar area any more. The room's were huge, very clean but could use a little furniture updating but was definitely worth what we paid. The gondolas are right next to this hotel which was very convenient. We didn't dine at the hotel so I can't say anything about the food. The next time I get a chance to back to Venice I will stay there again. I love that the Bauer is so close to the square where we could go in the evening and listen to the summer concerts. Fabulous !!!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: AnaHongKong
Reviews.Content: For $570 a night the Bauer put us in a superior room so small you hardly can turn around. There is not even place for a wardrobe to put your clothes in, you can hang your clothes above the mini-bar and put them on a board on two meters high (but no stairs to reach that board). The television and remote control (heavy!) belong in a museum, and better ignore the telephone altogether. Shower did not work properly. Only curtains seemed to be thought of during renovation. This surely is not 5* hotel quality. The front desk person told us that this room was were we paid for. Only after insisting and asking if he would like to spend that amount to stay in a cubicle we eventually were upgraded. The deluxe room is much better although not worth $780 by European standards. Location is great, food in the hotel is fine and there is a friendly concierge that informs you on tours. However, if you like to stay in this hotel better book a room in Il Palazzo, the Bauer hotel rooms are not worth it and the superior will spoil your romantic escape.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully memorable”
Reviews.Author: HelloSailor
Reviews.Content: Our two night stay at the Bauer was memorable and we will definitely return. Wonderful welcome, rooms clean and cool and quiet (although overlooking a side canal and gondola station). Perfectly located. Leave the windows open and hear the gondoliers singing or occasionally arguing. Magical! Friendly breakfast service overlooking the Grand Canal. Highly recommended.

HotelInfo.Name: Bauer Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: San Marco 1459 | Campo San Moise, 30124 Venice, Italy
